Overall, I'd say it's decent but by no means is it San Tung or "the best of the best" good.

excerpts: I usually order their steamed xiao long bao, pan fried xiao long bao, veggies, and their dry fried chicken wings.
However, there was inconsistency in the food the last time I went
dry fried chicken wings.author: Ange G.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I frequent here a lot. I usually order their steamed xiao long bao, pan fried xiao long bao, veggies, and their dry fried chicken wings. However, there was inconsistency in the food the last time I went but that's my only bad experience. 

I will still come back.

Do not expect great customer service. The place is small. Only Cash.

excerpts: I came to check this place out because I've been hearing my friends talk about how this place got better dry fried chicken wings than San tungs!
Their dry fried chicken wings are better than san tungs, but by just a little bit!
I love the crunchiness of it and the heavenly sauce with a kick to it.
It felt like I had an orgasm in the mouth when I took the first bite of that chicken wing bruh.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Kristoffer R.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I came to check this place out because I've been hearing my friends talk about how this place got better dry fried chicken wings than San tungs! I was skeptical, so I came to try it myself. 

The place is really small and there aren't that many tables. Me and my friends didn't get seated until 30 mins later because people were taking their precious time eating. When we finally got seated, we weren't really greeted so warmly. I just went straight on to order the chicken wings. It took a fairly long time to get what we order, but once it got to the table, I thought it was well worth the wait.

Their dry fried chicken wings are better than san tungs, but by just a little bit! I love the crunchiness of it and the heavenly sauce with a kick to it. It felt like I had an orgasm in the mouth when I took the first bite of that chicken wing bruh.

excerpts: I come here for the dry fried chicken wings.
They're good but the menu prices here are incorrect.
It's actually about double.
On top of that I just ordered pork chow mein and they gave me chicken.
WTF!
I don't want to eat chicken with chicken
dry fried chicken wings.author: Timur P.
dry fried chicken wings.review: I come here for the dry fried chicken wings. They're good but the menu prices here are incorrect. It's actually about double. On top of that I just ordered pork chow mein and they gave me chicken. WTF! I don't want to eat chicken with chicken

excerpts: We grabbed Shanghai Dumplings, Dry Fried Chicken Wings and this Vegetarian dish that consists of clear flat noodles (don't remember the exact name of this dish).
Dry Fried Chicken Wings - A must have for any chicken wings lover.
Hands down this itself deserves 5 STARS (just the other dishes weren't convincing haha).
Forget the lines at San Tung and come here for some amazing chicken wings.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Harriet W.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Officially tried this place when Shanghai Dumpling King closed and we decided to come here for food.

We grabbed Shanghai Dumplings, Dry Fried Chicken Wings and this Vegetarian dish that consists of clear flat noodles (don't remember the exact name of this dish).

Shanghai Dumplings was a disappointment, it was pretty flavorless and doesn't come close to the ones from Shanghai Dumpling King.

Clear Noodles - This was also okay. I remember trying this dish before (a long while ago when I just popped in on friends eating.) and it was much better. 

Dry Fried Chicken Wings - A must have for any chicken wings lover. Hands down this itself deserves 5 STARS (just the other dishes weren't convincing haha).  Forget the lines at San Tung and come here for some amazing chicken wings.

excerpts: The Dry Fried Chicken wings though.
I love chicken wings.
These were delicious.
Crispy and flavorful with a sweet and slightly slicy sauce.
The chicken was juicey and tender.
Awesome.
Only problem was the service.
Askes for water at the start of the meal.
Got it at the end.
Eh.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Zachary H.
dry fried chicken wings.review: Came in for lunch. Got the steamed pork dumplings. Very good. Also had greeon onion pancakes which were crispy and chewy. Also good quality. The Dry Fried Chicken wings though. I love chicken wings. These were delicious. Crispy and flavorful with a sweet and slightly slicy sauce. The chicken was juicey and tender.  Awesome. Only problem was the service. Askes for water at the start of the meal. Got it at the end. Eh.

excerpts:
Ordered the dry fried chicken wings, it IS much more flavorful than San Tung.
It's better. 
XLB, I've had better, the skin was thick yet fragile. 
Be careful when picking up.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Geordie E.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Ordered the dry fried chicken wings, it IS much more flavorful than San Tung.
It's better. 
XLB, I've had better, the skin was thick yet fragile. Be careful when picking up. 
Vegetarian Goose. Delicious! Similar to a dim sum, rolled tofu skin dish, except this is crispy and vegetarian. 
Pig Knuckle, we opted for the salt & pepper variant. Really good. Had enough to take home. 
We'll come back, try more dishes. Will not order the XLB again.

excerpts: the soup dumplings the dry fried chicken wings and the fried dumplings were most recommended so we ordered those - they were all very very good!
Actually, they were delicious!
and I will definitely go back for those.
We also tried a Shanghai fried noodle which was similar to a chow mein, it was very bland and needed lots of soy sauce...
the restaurant seems to be known for 10 main dishes, some being the fried pancakes, the soup dumplings the fried wings, the wine steamed fish and pork knuckle.
The service was terrible which was expected, so I did not complain or expect any different.
There is only one server in the restaurant who does not speak much English and is very curt and short
there was an hour wait for seating when we got there and the server had other patrons get up from their table and move to allow others to sit down.
While we were dining a few new customers came in and our server shouted out "to go only" not even allowing the customers to ask how long the wait was or if they could have a table.
The bad service did not upset nor disappoint me because I expected it already based on the TV show and going into it
I knew the food would be good.
I absolutely plan to go back for the delicious soup dumplings the fried chicken wings, the pork knuckle and the fried dumplings!
However, I do not expect the service to change.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Jennifer S.
dry fried chicken wings.review: We visited Shanghai house after seeing an episode of Check please! Bay Area... the soup dumplings the dry fried chicken wings and the fried dumplings were most recommended so we ordered those - they were all very very good! Actually, they were delicious! and I will definitely go back for those. We also tried a Shanghai fried noodle which was similar to a chow mein, it was very bland and needed lots of soy sauce... the restaurant seems to be known for 10 main dishes, some being the fried pancakes, the soup dumplings the fried wings, the wine steamed fish and pork knuckle. The service was terrible which was expected, so I did not complain or expect any different. There is only one server in the restaurant who does not speak much English and is very curt and short there was an hour wait for seating when we got there and the server had other patrons get up from their table and move to allow others to sit down. While we were dining a few new customers came in and our server shouted out "to go only" not even allowing the customers to ask how long the wait was or if they could have a table. The bad service did not upset nor disappoint me because I expected it already based on the TV show and going into it I knew the food would be good. I absolutely plan to go back for the delicious soup dumplings the fried chicken wings, the pork knuckle and the fried dumplings! However, I do not expect the service to change.

excerpts: Great place for XLB and dry fried chicken wings.

The wings aren't quite as good as San Tung's, in my opinion, but if you're in the Richmond and don't want to cross the park and wait over an hour to get your dry fried chicken wings, this place has got you covered.
The XLBs are well spaced so that they dont stick together and tear while picking them up and taste great.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Max K.
dry fried chicken wings.review: Great place for XLB and dry fried chicken wings.  The wings aren't quite as good as San Tung's, in my opinion, but if you're in the Richmond and don't want to cross the park and wait over an hour to get your dry fried chicken wings, this place has got you covered.  The XLBs are well spaced so that they dont stick together and tear while picking them up and taste great.  Green onion pancake was good too as well as sesame chicken and stir fried noodles shanghai style

excerpts: This place is like San Tung, but with more to offer than just Dry Fried Chicken Wings.
And finally the dry fried chicken wings are on par with San Tung with a good combination of crunch, sweet, salty, and spicy.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Tim W.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
This place is like San Tung, but with more to offer than just Dry Fried Chicken Wings.

The xiaolong bao have good flavor but are slightly lacking in broth. The vegetarian goose is excellent. The tofu is crisp, the mushrooms are perfectly soft and chewy and the sauce is a good mixture of sweet and salty. Also tried the green onion pancake which was flaky and crispy without being dry at all. And finally the dry fried chicken wings are on par with San Tung with a good combination of crunch, sweet, salty, and spicy.

excerpts: (Dry Fried Chicken Wings that rival San Tung's) but
the wait left a bitter taste in my mouth.
As much as I want to like Shanghai House, this experience made me reconsider ever going back again.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Greg C.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I've been here a couple of times for dinner and the food and service have usually been great. The convenient location across the street from Purple Kow (and the fact that they don't care if you bring the drinks in to enjoy with your dinner) make it a nice spot to just hangout and grub when there's no seating left at PKow.

Today must have been an off day though because the wait time for food from ordering to table delivery was 30+ minutes. Other tables who came in after us were served promptly, but my table and another in front of us seemed to be forgotten by the lone server and the seemingly overstaffed kitchen (didn't see much cooking going on as I passed by on the way to the bathroom). 

The food was good as always once it got to our table (Dry Fried Chicken Wings that rival San Tung's) but the wait left a bitter taste in my mouth. As much as I want to like Shanghai House, this experience made me reconsider ever going back again.

excerpts: We always order dry fried chicken wings, chicken fried rice with no eggs (i'm allergic) and the vegetarian spring rolls.
I love it with our favorite boba place across the street.
It is a small place if you choose to dine in, but if you can try the food during the lunch specials m-f 11-3, its worth it.
Best $7-$9 you'll spend per person!
dry fried chicken wings.author: Oluyemi O.
dry fried chicken wings.review: Me and my boyfriend come here all the time!! Yes it's one server that works really hard and does have the same expression, but she always knows my order and i feel we have a rapport. We always order dry fried chicken wings, chicken fried rice with no eggs (i'm allergic) and the vegetarian spring rolls. I love it with our favorite boba place across the street. It is a small place if you choose to dine in, but if you can try the food during the lunch specials m-f 11-3, its worth it. Best $7-$9 you'll spend per person!

excerpts:
I love this place,

i usually get the dry fried chicken wings, get ready to have your mouth explode with flavor.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Pete F.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I love this place,

i usually get the dry fried chicken wings, get ready to have your mouth explode with flavor. I used to always goto San Tung, loved their wings, but i prefer Shangai, tastes better and theres never a crazy wait.

I tried the fish and veggie dish today, and i had to stop one of the cooks on his way handing plates to other customers, had to give him proper respect.

The food here tastes very fresh, flavorful, and has good prices and filling portions. 

Ive seen some reviews saying that the waitress is rude. I would have to disagree. Sometimes when your food is bomb you dont have to stroke someones ego like a housecat. She always smiles and says thank you, show respect to a boss tho, she has 8 arms, and doesnt really make mistakes.

Lastly id say, why are you still reading this, if your hungry, or wanna impress somebody, go to Shanghai House.

excerpts: Dry fried chicken wings were crispy and yes almost as good as the ones at San Tung across the park.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Jennifer T.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
First time here with my cousin. It is a small hole in the wall but the food is pretty good

Got here around 7 pm and got seated at the last table and just missed the crowd.

Dry fried chicken wings were crispy and yes almost as good as the ones at San Tung across the park.

Sting beans with shrimp was yummy.

Vegetarian goose was better than expected.  Warm and crispy.

The lion head in the claypot was delicious.

Highly recommend you to give this place a try .

excerpts:
Great vegetable to noodle ratio too, not too starchy

- Dry fried chicken wings: the spicies just have more depth and the wings are cooked all the way through with care, while still maintaining tenderness.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Anna T.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Keep in mind that my review is for very very particular items on the menu.  I'm a believer that no Chinese restaurant is ever good if you just randomly order shit that you think "looks good" - you need to know what they make really well and order that.

So I'm also going to say something blasphemous here: their chicken wings are crispier, tastier, and have a more complex flavor than San Tung.  These are definitely my new crack wangz.  

What you should get:
- Handcut noodles (the fried kind, not the ones in soup): they're like chow fun, but better because the noodles are fresh and very tender.  Great vegetable to noodle ratio too, not too starchy

- Dry fried chicken wings: the spicies just have more depth and the wings are cooked all the way through with care, while still maintaining tenderness.  The sauce isn't as sticky as San Tung, so be sure to scoop some of that sauce ALLLLL over your wangz

- XLB: dude, so juicy.  not too much meat.  all about the soup inside.  I know I know Shanghai Dumpling King up the block is more famous, but I think this place makes it with so much more care even though you'll notice that there's a lot less meat in each XLB

Other reviews mentioned that the service here is not very good, but have you EVER been to a Chinese restaurant where there was good service AND cheap AND authentic AND delicious?  No, I definitely have not experienced that in the United States... maybe only in Taipei.  You'll get acceptable service from the lady if you just smile and act very polite to her as you would your grandma.  

You know what?  I'm gonna go back there tonight for dinner... just because I'm salivating while I write this review.  Shiet

excerpts: i love the dry fried chicken wings!
Soo gooooddd.
(:  its hot ans sweet yummmyyy.
Andd I LOVE LOVE LOVE THE DESSERT , EIGHT TREASURE SWEET STICKY RICE.
They dont have these anywhere at all.
They ony have it heree!
This is somethibg u must try here!
Its so goood.
Overall this place is awesome .
U must go here !
dry fried chicken wings.author: N S.
dry fried chicken wings.review: Omgg! I love this place! The food is soooo good! Like omg. I really recommend this shrimp dish . I forgot wats it called but it has shrimp and i love the shanghai dumpling! ANDD i love the dry fried chicken wings! Soo gooooddd.(:  its hot ans sweet yummmyyy. Andd I LOVE LOVE LOVE THE DESSERT , EIGHT TREASURE SWEET STICKY RICE. They dont have these anywhere at all. They ony have it heree! This is somethibg u must try here! Its so goood. Overall this place is awesome . U must go here !

excerpts: Dry Fried Chicken Wings:
Now this is perhaps the ONLY thing I really liked.
Some people thought the chicken wings were too battered up or that it was too spicy, but I thought it was PERFECT.
And what is also great is that their chicken wings are HUGE!
If i were to come back, I'd only order the wings.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Gelene V.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Came here off a comment that said the chicken wings at Shanghai House was BETTER than San Tung's. Does that even exist? Well that's what we were trying to figure out. 

The restaurant always seems to be a little empty, and at a glance can probably fit ~30 people. 

From their menu, these are the things I have tried before: 

Green Onion Pancake: Both times someone in my group ordered this, and both times the dish disappointed. When it comes out of the kitchen, it's warm and not hot - which makes me think they kept it in the freezer and just heated it up when customers order it. While I know most restaurants do that, it'd be nice if at least they FOOL me into thinking it was freshly made by coming out hot.... 

XLB: not bad, but not great either. If I was really craving XLBs, I'd just walk down the block and visit Dumpling King, sorry. 

Savory Rice Roll: The interior was cold!!!!! Need I say more?

Dry Sauteed String Beans: The flavor was a little bland, but we mixed this with the sauce that came with our chicken wings and it was MUCH better. Perhaps they should make a dish with the string beans solely in the chicken wings sauce (where is the suggestion box when you need it?)

Dry Fried Chicken Wings: Now this is perhaps the ONLY thing I really liked. Some people thought the chicken wings were too battered up or that it was too spicy, but I thought it was PERFECT. And what is also great is that their chicken wings are HUGE! If i were to come back, I'd only order the wings.

excerpts: Yes, the dry fried chicken wings are terrific.
A Must Order.
The green onion pancake was doughy and bland.
The Shanghai dumplings were OK, but there are better ones up the street.
The Shanghai noodles were inedible!
Maybe they are an acquired taste that I have not yet acquired.
But I saw other tables leaving a full dish of it when they departed, also.
dry fried chicken wings.author: franny s.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Don't understand the hype about this place. Yes, the dry fried chicken wings are terrific. A Must Order.
The green onion pancake was doughy and bland. The Shanghai dumplings were OK, but there are better ones up the street. The Shanghai noodles were inedible! Maybe they are an acquired taste that I have not yet acquired. But I saw other tables leaving a full dish of it when they departed, also. 
The guy behind us ordered Mongolian Beef and that looked pretty good. Maybe there are other dishes that are better at this place.
"Pelican Dreams" across the street at the Balboa Theatre was a terrific movie and quite convenient to this restaurant.

excerpts: On the bus I called to order Dry Fried Chicken Wings togo.
I got there within 15 minutes,
order still not ready.
Waited another 20 minutes to half an hour!
What the!
What was the point of calling in my order??
I don't think they started my order until I got to the restaurant.
The Chicken wings had ALOT of hard crunchy batter on it, the batter is so thick
, it seperates from the chicken and you can eat the batter on its own.
The chicken wings and drums were huge!
They aren't the small wings, they are the big ones!
Overall the taste was good but if you don't like thick batter, forget about it.
Also this is artery clogging for sure!
The sauce is SO Thick
it looked like tar
, I wonder what's in that sauce, kinda creeped me out after I scarfed it down.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Karen T.
dry fried chicken wings.review: I was craving chicken wings and I was going toward Balboa. I quickly yelped Chicken Wings in that area and found this place. On the bus I called to order Dry Fried Chicken Wings togo. I got there within 15 minutes, order still not ready. Waited another 20 minutes to half an hour! What the! What was the point of calling in my order?? I don't think they started my order until I got to the restaurant. The Chicken wings had ALOT of hard crunchy batter on it, the batter is so thick, it seperates from the chicken and you can eat the batter on its own. The chicken wings and drums were huge! They aren't the small wings, they are the big ones! Overall the taste was good but if you don't like thick batter, forget about it. Also this is artery clogging for sure! The sauce is SO Thick it looked like tar, I wonder what's in that sauce, kinda creeped me out after I scarfed it down.

excerpts: I usually order the dry fried chicken wings and green onion pancake.
I tried the bean curd vegetarian dish as well and everything is just yum yum.

It is definitely worth the wait, but they should do something about the glass window/wall/door in front of the place, because when we have to wait outside for a table, we can see everyone in the store, eating happily.
It is kind of awkward for us to stare at the customers insides and for the customers to see us standing in front of the place.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Annie X.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! I came here a couple of times and the food has been  consistently delicious. I usually order the dry fried chicken wings and green onion pancake. I tried the bean curd vegetarian dish as well and everything is just yum yum. 
It is definitely worth the wait, but they should do something about the glass window/wall/door in front of the place, because when we have to wait outside for a table, we can see everyone in the store, eating happily. It is kind of awkward for us to stare at the customers insides and for the customers to see us standing in front of the place.

excerpts:
soy been drink 
jelly fish salad
pickled vegetable and pork noodle soup
dry fried chicken wings
dry fried green beans
and most importantly, their salt and pepper pig knuckles....
dry fried chicken wings.author: Regi K.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Green Onion Pancakes
Xiao Lung bao
soy been drink 
jelly fish salad
pickled vegetable and pork noodle soup
dry fried chicken wings
dry fried green beans
and most importantly, their salt and pepper pig knuckles....

yum, yum, good.....   

there are limited tables, and service is not really great.   
We go there early as we have a toddler who loves noodles.  

good place, just be sure to bring cash.

excerpts: I can't wait for the dry fried chicken wings and dry sauteed string beans!
And the to-go orders are always so fast!
The lady always forgets to tell me how long it'll take
but I always assume 15 mins, and
dry fried chicken wings.author: Jessie C.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
The bf and I order from here a lot because it's close and it's good. The XLB are juicy, and the shanghai specialties (like stir fried rice cake, the braised bean thread sheet, fresh noodles) are all delicious. We've tried the shanghai style dim sum for lunch before too, and it's also good! This place really hits the spot when I'm craving savoury soy milk, onion pancake, fried dumpling-y bun things, and sticky rice rolls. I just ordered from them right now and am waiting for my takeout order. I can't wait for the dry fried chicken wings and dry sauteed string beans! And the to-go orders are always so fast! The lady always forgets to tell me how long it'll take but I always assume 15 mins, and when I get there it's always ready for me!

But be warned, CASH only! (there's a B of A a block away, though, if that's your bank)

excerpts: Dry fried chicken wings: nice and crispy, large and juicy!
dry fried chicken wings.author: Fontane L.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Looking for Shanghainese eats?  Shanghai House is a solid choice!  Yes, the service is not great, but I feel like it mostly had to do with the language barrier.  The food totally makes up for it!

XLB: Quite soupy, but the skin is a little thick for me.  Still, solid.

Dry fried chicken wings: nice and crispy, large and juicy!

Hot soy milk: OMG!  fresh made sweet soy milk is so good!  just hits the spot!

Pan fried hand-cut noodles: so-so...the noodles are nice and chewy, but it felt like it was mostly cabbage

excerpts: the dry fried chicken wings.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Jessica h.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I never really knew what a Xiao Long Bao was. There are just too many types of 'baos' and I get em all mixed up. Now I know, and I'm a believer. 

So..its this Shanghai dumpling (duh) that's steamed in a way that all the porky meat juices are retained within the skin. That liquid right there, is the shit. It's worth the risk of burning your tongue. I could eat a whole order of them (10 for ~$6)

Also good: the dry fried chicken wings. I think they're better than San Tung and without the 1hr wait!

The place is super small..and the waitress there is kinda in her own world, and you're pretty much on your own, but whatever. It's a good spot to grab some dumplings and other 'dim sum' stuff and doesn't put a dent in your wallet.

excerpts: Dry fried chicken wings - amazingly sweet and spicy and flavorful.
Definitely up to par with the infamous San Tung chicken.
Sadly, it is a little inconsistent -
It's sometimes better (spicier and sweeter) and sometimes worse (saltier) than San Tung's dry fried chicken.
Hand-cut noodles - tasted like a chow mein type dish.
Noodles were thick and uneven.
I enjoyed it, but it was a little too greasy.
Chinese donut - don't do it!
Really, it's not because it's disgustingly unhealthy and deep fried, but because it looks and tastes like it.
It looks kind of like a churro, minus the cinnamon and sugar and amazingness.
Imagine a long brick of dough, injected with butter and lard, and deep-fried.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Betty W.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
How do I express my love-hate relationship with Shanghai House?  I've loved their food since they opened, but the service drives me absolutely insane!!  There's only one woman working as the cashier/waitress/server/busboy; with all those responsibilities, you would think she's superwoman.......but she's not.  The service is ridiculously slow and the food takes ages to arrive.  That brings us to the sole reason why I continue to go to Shanghai House: the food is amazing.

1. Shanghai dumplings - 10 in each order, each perfectly plump and full of juices...soup I meant. (5/5)
2. Vegetarian goose - I honestly cannot tell you why it's called goose- I think it's made of some tofu skin.  I'm allergic but still order it anyway - that's how delicious it is, really. (5/5)
3. Dry fried chicken wings - amazingly sweet and spicy and flavorful.  Definitely up to par with the infamous San Tung chicken.  Sadly, it is a little inconsistent - It's sometimes better (spicier and sweeter) and sometimes worse (saltier) than San Tung's dry fried chicken. (4/5)
4. Hand-cut noodles - tasted like a chow mein type dish.  Noodles were thick and uneven.  I enjoyed it, but it was a little too greasy. (3/5)
4. Chinese donut - don't do it!  Really, it's not because it's disgustingly unhealthy and deep fried, but because it looks and tastes like it.  It looks kind of like a churro, minus the cinnamon and sugar and amazingness.  Imagine a long brick of dough, injected with butter and lard, and deep-fried.  (0/5)

Give yourself an extra 10 mins to find parking, and an additional 30 mins to wait for your food.

excerpts: My usual order consists of shanghai dumplings, dry fried chicken wings or shrimp, both are amazing... and depending on how many others are there, buddha's delight, the fried rice, or pork with vegetables and rice clay pot.
The chicken wings here are JUST as good as san tung, they are bigger and have a different flavor.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Diana H.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Usually busy at dinner. Service can be slow no matter what time of day, cash only. 

My usual order consists of shanghai dumplings, dry fried chicken wings or shrimp, both are amazing... and depending on how many others are there, buddha's delight, the fried rice, or pork with vegetables and rice clay pot. The chicken wings here are JUST as good as san tung, they are bigger and have a different flavor. More spicy, less sweet. 

If you don't feel like waiting, you can always order for take out.

excerpts: Dry fried chicken wings:
Good - has a great sweet spicy sauce, but the chicken is very high in fat because of being dipped in batter and deep fried.
Don't get me wrong the wings taste great
the batter is wonderfully crispy.
Sometimes things in life that are good aren't good for you.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Alaina I.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
It's possible the waitress was the also the person cooking the food because we arrived and waited quite a while before she showed up. 

Soup Dumplings: Average - There was very little soup, which is the only way I've found them so far in SF, most of mine broke and the meat was not as flavorful as others I've tried. 

Hand cut noodles: Average - noodles were good but meat quality and oily bland taste reminded me of mall fastfood.

Dry fried chicken wings: Good - has a great sweet spicy sauce, but the chicken is very high in fat because of being dipped in batter and deep fried. Don't get me wrong the wings taste great the batter is wonderfully crispy. Sometimes things in life that are good aren't good for you.

excerpts: Dry fried chicken wings is really good, but the service really have a big space to catch up.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Ricki Y.
dry fried chicken wings.review: Dry fried chicken wings is really good, but the service really have a big space to catch up.

excerpts: I never fail to order the dry fried chicken wings.
Best wings in SF hands down.
What about San Tung you say?
OVERHYPED.
Try these wings out, I promise you will not be disappointed ... unless you lack taste buds or something.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Colin H.
dry fried chicken wings.review: Ok, so after writing the initial review, I have been back to this place about 5 times. Each time I come back I never fail to order the dry fried chicken wings. Best wings in SF hands down. What about San Tung you say? OVERHYPED. Try these wings out, I promise you will not be disappointed ... unless you lack taste buds or something.

excerpts:
Chinese Menu
Dry fried chicken wings, fish, and shrimp - all very good and on par with San Tung

Hand pulled Noodles with black bean sauce and spicy dan dan noodles reminds me of San Tung.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Cin T.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Authentic Shanghainese food.  Cash Only

There are 2 menu - be sure to ask for both.

Shanghainese Menu 
Pork Knuckle (Special - should call to order in advance since it takes a long time to cook) - A big chunk of slow roasted , flavorful and tender meat. 

XLB - As good as it gets.  On par with Shanghai Dumpling House 

Ricecake, sweet or savory soy bean  milk, vegetarian goose, wonton, and other dumplings are all authentic.   

Chinese Menu
Dry fried chicken wings, fish, and shrimp - all very good and on par with San Tung

Hand pulled Noodles with black bean sauce and spicy dan dan noodles reminds me of San Tung.  Large portion and decent price.

Service/Ambience - Small restaurant with 20-30 seats.  Service can be slow when it's a full house.  

Before this place opened, I use to go to the Shanghai Dumpling King.  Now I prefer this place because it is less crowded, cleaner, and has really good chicken wings.

excerpts: From the reviews I've read, I decided I wanted to try tan tan noodles and dry fried chicken wings.
The tan tan noodles reminded me of the cold noodles from San Tung except they weren't peanut buttery.
The noodles were really oily and I regret ordering them.
The chicken wings were delicious and way better than the ones San Tung served.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Connie C.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
This place gets 3 stars because my experiences vary from visit to visit. The first time I came here, I had a great experience just because their onion pancake was better than shanghai dumpling king up a couple blocks. 

From the reviews I've read, I decided I wanted to try tan tan noodles and dry fried chicken wings. The tan tan noodles reminded me of the cold noodles from San Tung except they weren't peanut buttery. The noodles were really oily and I regret ordering them. The chicken wings were delicious and way better than the ones San Tung served. However, when I ordered them again on a second visit, the chicken was bland and tasteless, so if you ever order it, cross your fingers that they marinated it right. 

The only items I would recommend would be the onion pancakes and maybe the pork and veggie steam dumplings.

excerpts:
focus on the shanghainese stuff, like the savory soy milk and the sesame dessert in rice wine
the dry fried chicken wings are good too
the place itself is tiny with no room to wait (also, how often do you walk through the kitchen to get to the upstairs bathroom?)
interior stark but clean
dry fried chicken wings.author: Rob C.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I tried the XLB from Shanghai Dumpling King and Shanghai House on the same day.  Shanghai House has the edge.  perfect size, rich juice, more flavorful contents and just the right wrapper, steamed to perfection. SDK has more dumpling variety including crab dumplings, but their wrapper is a little thinner and contents a little less flavorful.
Of course, this all goes out the window, compared to DTF.

I agree though that you have to choose the right things from the menu to appreciate this place.  focus on the shanghainese stuff, like the savory soy milk and the sesame dessert in rice wine
the dry fried chicken wings are good too
the place itself is tiny with no room to wait (also, how often do you walk through the kitchen to get to the upstairs bathroom?)
interior stark but clean

excerpts: Dry fried chicken wings?
I order the dry fried chicken wings and they're DELICIOUS.
Crispy and golden sweet on the outside, juicy on the inside.
Kathleen even made the bold statement that these might be better than San Tung's chicken wings.
I'm still on the fence about it
but they were
Excellent xiao long bao and dry fried chicken wings without the wait?
Oh, I might be in love.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Patrick L.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
My friends who used to live in the city were in town yet they had never experienced the joy of San Tung's chicken wings. PURE BLASPHEMY. So we head on over and grab a great parking spot. But something is amiss...

Me: Wait, where are the people? Where are the lights? WHERE ARE THE CHICKEN WINGS?!

There's a sign that says they'll be closed until April 6th. 

OH GOD, WHY HAVE YOU FORSAKEN ME!!

After I calm down, we head on over to their sister restaurant, So, because I'm a man on a mission. But they're closed too. 

OH GOD, WHY ARE YOU PUNISHING ME!!!

Desperate and hungry, we cross over the Golden Gate Park and even farther out into the avenues. I decide that we should go to Shanghai House because it's new, they had great xiao long bao the last time I was there with Ed M, and there wouldn't be a wait. 

We're seated and I realize that I don't recognize anything on the menu. Hunan prawns? Garlic eggplant? Where's the hand cut pan fried noodles? WHERE'S MY CHINESE FOOD?!

Shanghai House has two different menus. Me and Mikey the Whitey got the white man menus while Ed (not M) and Kathleen got the menus with the good stuff. Goddamnit. 

But oh wait, what's this on the white man menu? Dry fried chicken wings? OH SWEET SWEET IRONY. 

I order the dry fried chicken wings and they're DELICIOUS. Crispy and golden sweet on the outside, juicy on the inside. Kathleen even made the bold statement that these might be better than San Tung's chicken wings. I'm still on the fence about it but they were oh so good. 

Excellent xiao long bao and dry fried chicken wings without the wait? Oh, I might be in love.

excerpts: And of course, the dry fried chicken wings (I'm bias since I love this almost everywhere
I go...
dry fried chicken wings.author: Eddie C.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Good example of REAL chinese food.

Simple ingredients that enhances the flavors.  Not greasy or "Sweet / Sour"
The Pork/Cabbage dumplings are good.  And of course, the dry fried chicken wings (I'm bias since I love this almost everywhere I go...AND you don't have to wait an hour for San Tung - a bit over rated)

Try the noodle soup, chicken wings and dumplings.  Just remember its a Shanghai restaurant...and don't expect the normal Chinese "style" Restaurant.

excerpts: It's like the San Tung dry fried chicken wings, but with more molasses taste over fried fish.
Quite tasty, my favorite dish there.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Joann C.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I would give this place 4.5 stars if I could.  The food here is great, but the service can be very slow at times.  It's basically one woman taking care of the entire floor and sometimes her daughter.  Going at off times is ideal.  If you're going to order takeout, call ahead.  

They have a dish called dry fried fish.  It's like the San Tung dry fried chicken wings, but with more molasses taste over fried fish.  Quite tasty, my favorite dish there.  The XLB generally are very tasty, but I have gotten it on an off day once where they weren't nearly as juicy.  

Last I went they don't serve alcohol, but you're allowed to bring in your own.

excerpts: The other dish to try is the dry fried chicken wings.
If I recall, they're on the menu with the chow mein and such.
When they give you the menu, make sure you get both versions; the traditional and the Americanized one.
Some dishes appear on both menus, though.
The wings are pretty good-sized and very tasty.
They come out piled high on a plate, glistening and sticky, from the sweet and spicy sauce.
Fried super cripsy, so that it seals all the heat and moist chicken inside.
Be careful though, they're sweet and very hot (in temperature), so either wait a bit or make your first bite a tiny one.
These wings are really addictive.
How can you go wrong?
They're deep fried, super crunchy, sweet, and spicy.
dry fried chicken wings.author: CE Y.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
I'm not an expert on Northern Chinese food, but this place seems pretty decent and authentic.  The xiao lung bao (shanghai dumplings) haven't failed me, yet.  I've had my share of pretty bad xlb in San Francisco and was on the lookout for good ones.  These dumplings are served to you piping hot in the bamboo steamer.  The filling is very tender and full of soup.  The best thing to do is to order one basket of xlb, for 2 people.  I don't mind sharing, I just don't want to end up with ONLY 2 dumplings for my portion.  At least 1/2 an order is enough for me.

The other dish to try is the dry fried chicken wings.  If I recall, they're on the menu with the chow mein and such.  When they give you the menu, make sure you get both versions; the traditional and the Americanized one.  Some dishes appear on both menus, though.  The wings are pretty good-sized and very tasty.  They come out piled high on a plate, glistening and sticky, from the sweet and spicy sauce.  Fried super cripsy, so that it seals all the heat and moist chicken inside.  Be careful though, they're sweet and very hot (in temperature), so either wait a bit or make your first bite a tiny one.  These wings are really addictive.  How can you go wrong?  They're deep fried, super crunchy, sweet, and spicy.  Forget buffalo wings, these are the way to go!

I've tried some of the other noodle dishes, but will have to go back several more times, to try other items, and add them to my review.
If you should decide to eat here, make sure you have plenty of time.  There will be a wait.  There's only one server and food comes out of the kitchen at a somewhat moderate pace.  I don't mind, because I know that the dishes are freshly made.

excerpts: The dry fried chicken wings weren't as tasty as expected and the dumplings were nice but not out of this world.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Jacquee P.
dry fried chicken wings.review:
Cheap eats in a sparse and clean space.

We really enjoyed the tea smoked duck and rice cakes. The wintermelon soup is also good but I know that I can make it at home for like a fraction of the price. The dry fried chicken wings weren't as tasty as expected and the dumplings were nice but not out of this world.

I am used to eating Cantonese style Chinese food and this was a nice diversion from the usual. 

I like how the dining room is just that. It's so small that every inch of the front of the house is used for seating customers. And the customer base makes it feel like you're in someone house. I saw a woman feed her elderly mother at dinner and it was just so sweet.

excerpts: Anyway there are always 3 standards we order when coming here the dry fried chicken wings (sweeter than san tung), the xao ling bao soup dumplings, and the pan fried home made noodles with pork.
His doesn't leave room for much else unless ur eating with more than 3 people.
Anywho the last time we came here (last week) of the 6 times i've been here
the chicken wings were freak'n amazing
, it looks like thy have perfected their cooking method.
I mean the wings were always to hot to touch when they came out, but his time they were super crispy and the sauce stuck to them with all the little garlic and chili pepper bits.

Don't over look their hand made noodles tho, their soft and chewy texture is created from hand rolling the noodles, and some times you'll get a glimpse of them making them when u pass by a room on the way to the bathroom upstairs.
All in all this place is always consistantly good, but this last time was great.
The only downer would be the that the owner whom i assume is the server lady isn't always in the best of moods
lol
dry fried chicken wings.author: Spencer W.
dry fried chicken wings.review: I believe this is an update to a previous review i gave this restaurant.  Anyway there are always 3 standards we order when coming here the dry fried chicken wings (sweeter than san tung), the xao ling bao soup dumplings, and the pan fried home made noodles with pork.  His doesn't leave room for much else unless ur eating with more than 3 people.  Anywho the last time we came here (last week) of the 6 times i've been here the chicken wings were freak'n amazing, it looks like thy have perfected their cooking method.  I mean the wings were always to hot to touch when they came out, but his time they were super crispy and the sauce stuck to them with all the little garlic and chili pepper bits.  Don't over look their hand made noodles tho, their soft and chewy texture is created from hand rolling the noodles, and some times you'll get a glimpse of them making them when u pass by a room on the way to the bathroom upstairs.  All in all this place is always consistantly good, but this last time was great. The only downer would be the that the owner whom i assume is the server lady isn't always in the best of moods lol

excerpts: I also like the spicy dry fried chicken wings.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Joel M.
dry fried chicken wings.review: My only complaint with this place is that its cash only.  Shanghai house is great on the weekend for a late breakfast early lunch.  The special pork dumplings contain broth inside giving them great flavor.  I also like the spicy dry fried chicken wings.

excerpts: The XLB was juicy, the dry fried chicken wings were good, not quite as good at San Tung, but decent.
Good place to have a good Shanghai meal during off peak hours.
Come when its busy and the food becomes inconsistent.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Alan N.
dry fried chicken wings.review: This place is small, so be prepared to wait during prime times.  The XLB was juicy, the dry fried chicken wings were good, not quite as good at San Tung, but decent.  Good place to have a good Shanghai meal during off peak hours.  Come when its busy and the food becomes inconsistent.

excerpts: So from start to finish, we had the green onion pancakes, dry fried chicken wings, pork and preserved green hand cut noodle soup, lion's head meatballs (not really a lion's head people), XLB, and soy bean milk.
I'm pretty sure I'm missing something since I counted 7 things on the check
but for the life of me can't remember.
Everything we had was delicious - my favorites being the lion's head meat ball, hand cut noodle soup (mostly because of the noodles -
I think I've had the beef noodle soup
and I think I liked it more), and the dry fried chicken wings.
Note: Everything else was good, just picking my favorites.
The chicken wings actually have a leg up on Santung and are spicier/crispier.
The only thing with the wings is that they are sweet, but I have a feeling if you like Santung you won't mind this one too.
Just working on watching the sugar + calories, so that made me a bit sad... had to restrain myself from eating the whole thing
so I wouldn't have a heart attack.
dry fried chicken wings.author: Jeannette L.
dry fried chicken wings.review: What surprises me about this place is that despite the fact that I thought we had over ordered, we somehow managed to finish everything. So from start to finish, we had the green onion pancakes, dry fried chicken wings, pork and preserved green hand cut noodle soup, lion's head meatballs (not really a lion's head people), XLB, and soy bean milk. I'm pretty sure I'm missing something since I counted 7 things on the check but for the life of me can't remember. Everything we had was delicious - my favorites being the lion's head meat ball, hand cut noodle soup (mostly because of the noodles - I think I've had the beef noodle soup and I think I liked it more), and the dry fried chicken wings. Note: Everything else was good, just picking my favorites. The chicken wings actually have a leg up on Santung and are spicier/crispier. The only thing with the wings is that they are sweet, but I have a feeling if you like Santung you won't mind this one too. Just working on watching the sugar + calories, so that made me a bit sad... had to restrain myself from eating the whole thing so I wouldn't have a heart attack.

excerpts: What a mistake, the Mongolian beef was so filled with chili paste and hot to the point it was not edible.
I returned it and settled for the Xiao dumplings, which were quite good.
The chow mein my girlfriend ordered, had no flavor at all.
Maybe we should have just had wings, or the dumplings.
Better yet, go somewhere else ....
sad part is I'm Chinese!
mongolian beef.author: Jeff L.
mongolian beef.review:
Think twice before going! We watched the bay area's check please, and decided to check it out.
What a mistake, the Mongolian beef was so filled with chili paste and hot to the point it was not edible.  I returned it and settled for the Xiao dumplings, which were quite good. The chow mein my girlfriend ordered, had no flavor at all.  Maybe we should have just had wings, or the dumplings.  Better yet, go somewhere else .... sad part is I'm Chinese!

excerpts: Mongolian Beef ($9.95) - way too spicy for my palate.
i can barely eat a few bites before my palate goes on fire.
they'll need to tone the heat down.
OH
YES, MINUS ONE STAR for the extreme spice.
Did you know that they cook their mongolian beef with red chilli flakes AND jalapeno?
jalapeno?!?
!?!?! i found chopped pieces in my dish. absolutely, dislike.
mongolian beef.author: Jane A.
mongolian beef.review:
OOH WEE! XLB
(3.25  stars)

While walking around this neighborhood, I've discovered a great place while exploring in city suburbia. Who knew they'd be a great hidden treasure in city suburbia!!!!! And especially a place that servers some great XLB. The place was packed and there was no room to sit so an order to-go was ideal. 

- taste, delicious
- price, affordable
- service, semi-okay
- ambiance, small space (its as big as my livingroom/kitchen)

Shanghai Dumplings aka XLB ($5.95) - comes in 10 pieces. that's great price for such a delicious dumpling. definately not stingy! 

Mongolian Beef ($9.95) - way too spicy for my palate. i can barely eat a few bites before my palate goes on fire. they'll need to tone the heat down. OH YES, MINUS ONE STAR for the extreme spice. Did you know that they cook their mongolian beef with red chilli flakes AND jalapeno? jalapeno?!?!?!?! i found chopped pieces in my dish. absolutely, dislike.  Entrees do not come with rice so you might need to order a side of rice. 

I'd love to come here again for some dimsum. This time eating there at a table and trying other dimsum dishes. I'd prefer dimsum here over the entree dishes. When my friends want dimsum, i'll definately know a great place to take them.

Will i be back? OF COURSE

Until the next review...

excerpts: Mongolian beef - This dish was extra spicy!
mongolian beef.author: Anne T.
mongolian beef.review:
My favorite foodie friend from SoCal suggested we go to Shanghai house since there are no great places you can get dim sum in LA.. She's been craving dumplings and needed to satisfy her craving before she left town again. I was running a little late, so she went ahead and placed the order for the following:

Pan cut noodles - Must get these! So yummy! I wish I could have this after a drunken night on the town. 

Dry chicken wings - Doesn't look too appetizing.. But these chicken wings are probably just as good as San Tung's but crispier and spicier!

Shanghai dumplings - I can see why she wanted these. So delicious!!!

Pork & vegetables pot-stickers - These tasted good as well. But I would have liked another order of the Shanghai Dumplings!

Stir-fried eggplant - this dish was good. It wasn't a stand out but definitely a good side dish. 

Mongolian beef - This dish was extra spicy! The kick basically took me out for awhile!

Green beans - Wow. What a simple yet crispy, refreshingly crunchy! Not the usual overcooked green beans you get. I highly recommend getting this along with the noodles and dry chicken wings!

Enjoy!

excerpts: Our staples are Mongolian beef, dry fry wings, and xiao long boa, and you can't beat the price either.
You can eat like a king for 30 bucks(cash only).
Their Mongolian beef is amazing, its not that typical beef in brown sauce, theirs is so fresh with onions, jalapeño, chilis, and other good stuff.
But this pales in comparison to the dry fry wings.
I have no idea what they do to these wings
but they are amazingly delicious, perfectly balanced between spicy and sweet always crunchy and incredibly moist inside.
Also they are huge for wings.
Their xiao long bao or soup dumplings are also amazing and worth the sometimes wait.
Large delicious dumplings filled with flavorful soup and meat...mmmm
mongolian beef.author: P N.
mongolian beef.review: My absolute favorite Chinese restaurant in the city!  We come here at least once a month but usually more.  Our staples are Mongolian beef, dry fry wings, and xiao long boa, and you can't beat the price either.  You can eat like a king for 30 bucks(cash only).  Their Mongolian beef is amazing, its not that typical beef in brown sauce, theirs is so fresh with onions, jalapeño, chilis, and other good stuff.  But this pales in comparison to the dry fry wings.  I have no idea what they do to these wings but they are amazingly delicious, perfectly balanced between spicy and sweet always crunchy and incredibly moist inside.  Also they are huge for wings.  Their xiao long bao or soup dumplings are also amazing and worth the sometimes wait.  Large delicious dumplings filled with flavorful soup and meat...mmmm

excerpts: The guy behind us ordered Mongolian Beef and that looked pretty good.
Maybe there are other dishes that are better at this place.
"Pelican Dreams" across the street at the Balboa Theatre was a terrific movie and quite convenient to this restaurant.
mongolian beef.author: franny s.
mongolian beef.review:
Don't understand the hype about this place. Yes, the dry fried chicken wings are terrific. A Must Order.
The green onion pancake was doughy and bland. The Shanghai dumplings were OK, but there are better ones up the street. The Shanghai noodles were inedible! Maybe they are an acquired taste that I have not yet acquired. But I saw other tables leaving a full dish of it when they departed, also. 
The guy behind us ordered Mongolian Beef and that looked pretty good. Maybe there are other dishes that are better at this place.
"Pelican Dreams" across the street at the Balboa Theatre was a terrific movie and quite convenient to this restaurant.

excerpts: The Mongolian Beef and the Kung Pao Chicken was pretty good.
The Kung Pao was definitely spicier than the Mongolian Beef however and the peanuts compliments it very very well.
The Mongolian Beef was nice and tender, but I had preferred it to be just as spicy or spicier than the Kung Pao.
mongolian beef.author: Killah K.
mongolian beef.review:
A quaint and cozy place that delivers relatively good food at reasonable prices. The owner and the Chef themselves are actually Shanghai-nese (I myself come from Shanghai, China) so that brought my expectations even higher. 

The first thing I ordered was the Shanghai pork dumplings. You can't come to a Shanghai-nese restaurant without first trying the dumplings. The dumplings were Good. Juices were flowing inside the skin and the skin itself was not hard - which tells you that they are using the right kind of skin. The meatball inside was also cooked perfectly. So for the dumplings, it has my vote. ::thumbs up:: 

I then ordered the Sour and spicy soup - which to my surprise was kind of disappointing. Way too sour for my taste and not spicy at all. Unbalanced and very one-sided. The amount of veggies included in the soup was pretty good, but I couldnt taste any of it due to the overwhelming sour-ness. There was also a slight bitterness that I didn't like. Maybe they derived from the traditional way of making this soup in order to make it more original? I do not know. 

Following the soup I ordered Fried Tofu. Very nice. Was not deep fried like the other Fried Tofu's out there. The fried skin is very thin - covering the tofu just barely. The tofu was also soft - not firm which is the right way to make fried tofu. This I give my ::thumbs up:: 

The Mongolian Beef and the Kung Pao Chicken was pretty good. The Kung Pao was definitely spicier than the Mongolian Beef however and the peanuts compliments it very very well. The Mongolian Beef was nice and tender, but I had preferred it to be just as spicy or spicier than the Kung Pao. 

Overall, the experience was a good one. The service was okay considering that there's only one waiter there. It would've been nice if they had accepted major credit cards, but I guess it is to keep costs low. A little inconvenient, but bearable. Bank of America is literally a block away on the corner. 


Bottom Line: More or less authentic with some deviation from traditional depending what you get. Overall good experience. It was good, but not fantastic. I do support local businesses so I would go here again.

excerpts: Mongolian beef was soooooo spicy, but also very good.
It's BYOB - which is cool.
However, service I incredibly slow and fairly unfriendly - however according to my Chinese dining mate, he wouldn't expect it any other way.
mongolian beef.author: Heather L.
mongolian beef.review: Shanghai dumplings, pot stickers, wonton soup, all amazing.  Mongolian beef was soooooo spicy, but also very good.  It's BYOB - which is cool.  However, service I incredibly slow and fairly unfriendly - however according to my Chinese dining mate, he wouldn't expect it any other way.

excerpts: Mongolian Beef -  was good because it was not drowning in oil like how most Chinese restaurant cook it.
mongolian beef.author: Elle W.
mongolian beef.review:
4 Stars because it was a clean and quaint restaurant AND the food tasted fresh and was NOT  greasy !!! Major pluses!!! 

Food was about 3.

We ordered:

Shanghai Dumplings- did an excellent job on the skin - very thin and and not so chewy or soggy. The inside (meat filling) was moist but not filled with juices as it should have.,  BUT this is still better than Shanghai Dumpling King a few blocks down....(Shanghai Dumpling King's food has really dropped dramatically in taste and quality over the years.... I don't understand why people still line up for that place... SDK is sooooo overrated).

Mongolian Beef -  was good because it was not drowning in oil like how most Chinese restaurant cook it.  It came with rice , but the rice was not fresh, maybe I just got the bottom of the rice cooker ... who knows, but let's not dwell on it.

Hand Cut Beef Noodle soup -. This is very very very good!! They did an excellent job cutting  the noodles in thin slices.. and was cooked perfectly... not too soggy and too chewy. The soup was light in flavor but not bland and not heavy with salt or MSG.  They also gave a good portion of this dish. I absolutely LOVE hand cut noodles and I have tried many many places....... this place does it right. It is also really hard to find a good place in SF that even serves this type of noodles. 

Service: Slow.....Well.... there is only  one waitress, and boy.... that is one pokered faced lady... If she was holding a 5 card dud  in her hand and her opponent is holding a Royal Flush... she'd make that person doubt, fold and she'd win!! She'd be THAT good!!!!!.I.. think the only time she cracked a smile was when my  toddlers saw  her coming to the table with food and the kids jaws drop because of the sight of food. That jaw dropping , gwaking face of my cutties... finally put a grin and a light chuckle to her. We took our time eating... and eventually made small talk with her, which was nice (yes, her face was still pokered when we talked) but we did have a nice conversation.

Over all, we will definitely be coming back here. Clean, quaint, and good food.

Note: They have 2 different Menus. One is their Shanghai Menu and the other lists all the Chinese generic dishes you find every where else. I say.... stick with the Shanghai Menu.

And for those of you wondering what our small talk was about..  here you go: the Master Chef is from Shanghai.. have been living in the states for 10 years... his wife (the pokered faced lady is the waitress).....they had owned another restaurant for 7 years prior to Shanghai House).... and on and on.... like I side it was a nice conversation.

excerpts: The broccoli beef was okay - too sweet.
broccoli beef.author: J Z.
broccoli beef.review:
It has been over 8 years since I last visited the Shanghai House and now I remember why.  The service was and continues to be horrible.  It is slow and unfriendly.  The food was mixed.  The kung pow chicken was good.  The wonton soup was very disappointing. Frozen dumplings are never a good thing and the soup was very greasy tasting.  The broccoli beef was okay - too sweet. 

Not recommended

excerpts: Definitely recommend the more traditional dishes, like Xiao Long Bao, over dishes like broccoli beef.
Pro tip: use the Chinese menu, it's way better.
broccoli beef.author: Christopher L.
broccoli beef.review: Small place so there's only one waiter (long waits) but the food is delicious. Definitely recommend the more traditional dishes, like Xiao Long Bao, over dishes like broccoli beef. Pro tip: use the Chinese menu, it's way better.

excerpts: Do not order from the sucker menu (you'll spot it fast - its the one with sweet and sour pork and broccoli beef).
You're in a Shanghai restaurant.
Order Shanghai food.
broccoli beef.author: Candy C.
broccoli beef.review:
This place is depressing. Its small, its quiet and the music they play sometimes makes you want to cry. But the food makes you forget about life and say to yourself, it is going to be okay ;)

Shanghai House popped my shanghai dumpling cherry, and for that reason, it will always have a special place in my heart. I have searched high and low for another Shanghai restaurant for things equally as good as the menu here and I always come home to the outter richmond. Never mind the fact no freeway exits take you there or that you need to travel 20 minutes within the city to make it there. This is where my heart lies.

The claypot vermicelli and the tea smoked duck are a must have for any visit as I have not seen it on any other Shanghai menu. Do not order from the sucker menu (you'll spot it fast - its the one with sweet and sour pork and broccoli beef). You're in a Shanghai restaurant. Order Shanghai food.

excerpts: For my entree, I ordered the Broccoli Beef -- it was smothered in a "gloppy" brown sauce and was nothing special.
I can't see myself going back.
broccoli beef.author: Paul L.
broccoli beef.review: As another reviewer noted, the service is SLOW. I ordered pot stickers -- those were good. For my entree, I ordered the Broccoli Beef -- it was smothered in a "gloppy" brown sauce and was nothing special. I can't see myself going back.

excerpts: Aka one had things like sweet and sour chicken, broccoli beef and the other had things like pork knuckles.
broccoli beef.author: Tiffany L.
broccoli beef.review:
Something eerie happened the night I visited here.  I had heard this place can get real crowded with a line waiting out the door.  But on this night, there was not a single person in the place.  We walked in and the waitress had to come out from the back to speak to us.  We sat at a table for 6, within 4 SECONDS the ENTIRE place was filled to the brim.  Still have no idea what happened.  I hear the service isnt great here but the ONE waitress serving the tiny place wasnt bad at all.  She got our orders right quick and refilled everything in a quick fashion.  The place is much cleaner than the dumpling place next door but has a smaller selection.  They had two menus:  one for the Asians and one for the non Asians.  Aka one had things like sweet and sour chicken, broccoli beef and the other had things like pork knuckles.  

Tip: get the fried chicken wings.  To DIE for.  Don't use the creepy bathroom upstairs, save your shit for home.

excerpts: then the sweet and sour pork...this isnt your neon pink red pork that you find at any chinese restaurant.
This pork is cooked differently...a deliciously good different..the sauce is dark and thick and has a somehwat sticky conistency..
i have a hunch its honey..
sweet and sour pork.author: phillip w.
sweet and sour pork.review:
I dont know what some people are saying about how this place serves bad Xiao Lung Bao...

yes it had the soup and if you notice, these things are smaller so that it fits your tiny mouth...and when you bite into it, there wont be a spray taht hits everyone across the room...

the chicken wings are incredible...they are spicy but when you first bite into them it gives u a zing but after taht....its gone and tastes sooo good. Last time i had chicken wings this good were at marnee thai and thats a whole different taste. The skin on that chicken was crispy and juicy omg...*drooooooooool*

then the sweet and sour pork...this isnt your neon pink red pork that you find at any chinese restaurant. This pork is cooked differently...a deliciously good different..the sauce is dark and thick and has a somehwat sticky conistency..i have a hunch its honey..but anyhow that pork kicks ass...

and then there is the fried bread(man tao)..so crunchy on the outside nice and soft on the inside..

the only downfall about this place is that there is only one person working the front so that it might take some time...but its worth the wait~

excerpts: Do not order from the sucker menu (you'll spot it fast - its the one with sweet and sour pork and broccoli beef).
You're in a Shanghai restaurant.
Order Shanghai food.
sweet and sour pork.author: Candy C.
sweet and sour pork.review:
This place is depressing. Its small, its quiet and the music they play sometimes makes you want to cry. But the food makes you forget about life and say to yourself, it is going to be okay ;)

Shanghai House popped my shanghai dumpling cherry, and for that reason, it will always have a special place in my heart. I have searched high and low for another Shanghai restaurant for things equally as good as the menu here and I always come home to the outter richmond. Never mind the fact no freeway exits take you there or that you need to travel 20 minutes within the city to make it there. This is where my heart lies.

The claypot vermicelli and the tea smoked duck are a must have for any visit as I have not seen it on any other Shanghai menu. Do not order from the sucker menu (you'll spot it fast - its the one with sweet and sour pork and broccoli beef). You're in a Shanghai restaurant. Order Shanghai food.

excerpts: The sweet and sour pork was excellent!
sweet and sour pork.author: dj z.
sweet and sour pork.review:
Wow, the place was incredibly clean, and even though the waitstaff was slow in such a small place, the food was worth it.

The sweet and sour pork was excellent! Flat thinly sliced pieces in a crispy batter, not too heavy or too sweet.

The Sesame chicken and dried fried chicken wings were way too sweet for my taste. The Buddha's Delight veggie combo was awesome, even though it didn't have the customary fried tofu pockets and glass noodles.

Will definitely come here again if I find myself near the beach soon!

excerpts: We ordered off of the Shanghai specials and were disappointed by the twice cooked pork (they used the wrong type of pork) and the shrimp (it's supposed to come with a vinegar dipping sauce)
I know I'm being harsh, but I guess I had high hopes since it's been ages since my last trip to Shanghai

...guess I'll just have to keep dreaming about really awesome Chinese food until my next trip, in the meantime the food isn't bad here, but there are plenty of other Chinese restaurants with the same quality that don't make you wait forever to eat.
twice cooked pork.author: T V.
twice cooked pork.review:
My family was visiting me over the weekend and after a day at Land's End they were pretty hungry.  The thing is my dad will only eat Chinese food, ok my brothers and I have since convinced him Pho is good and he'll tolerate Korean food, but that's pretty much it.  With that in mind I've been craving some really good Shanghainese food and I heard about Shanghai House through Yelp at that 7x7 list.  

First of all the service was extremely slow.  We waited a good 25 minutes before we even received our Xiaolongbao and eventually the rest of our food started trickling out as well.  We thought no big deal, since I was hoping to finally find a Chinese restaurant that would get it right.  

The Xiaolongbao was alright, the flavor was good, but they were tiny, but at least soupy. We ordered off of the Shanghai specials and were disappointed by the twice cooked pork (they used the wrong type of pork) and the shrimp (it's supposed to come with a vinegar dipping sauce)...I know I'm being harsh, but I guess I had high hopes since it's been ages since my last trip to Shanghai...guess I'll just have to keep dreaming about really awesome Chinese food until my next trip, in the meantime the food isn't bad here, but there are plenty of other Chinese restaurants with the same quality that don't make you wait forever to eat.

excerpts: They have one menu of standard chinese fare but done better than any place I have tried; kung pao chicken, twice cooked pork etc.
And one menu of more esoteric dishes that they probably wont give you unless you are asian or if you ask for it.
The second menu has sizzling clay pot rice, pork belly, pork knuckle...
Be sure and check this place out
twice cooked pork.author: Vincent C.
twice cooked pork.review:
I would just give this five stars if it was only based on the food.  The service is simply lacking...sloooowwww.
That being said, the food is some of the best chinese I have had.  If you dine in be sure and ask for both menus.  They have one menu of standard chinese fare but done better than any place I have tried; kung pao chicken, twice cooked pork etc. And one menu of more esoteric dishes that they probably wont give you unless you are asian or if you ask for it.  The second menu has sizzling clay pot rice, pork belly, pork knuckle...
Be sure and check this place out

excerpts: Dry sauteed string beans = awesome.
A bit spicy, tangy and sweet.
The pickled vegetables were a great addition.
Well cooked beans.
(I loathe undercooked beans that are squeaky as a result.)
dry sauteed string beans.author: Fannie S.
dry sauteed string beans.review:
Food = great.

Green onion pancake = A bit crispy, a bit doughy and quite delicious. $5.95.

Xiao long bao = juicy dumplings with great filling. Ginger heaven. Best to eat them when they land on the table. Piping hot. $8.50.

San jian bao = awesome. Crispy dough and juicy filling. It doesn't run like the XLB but it's quite good, too. $11.95

Hot & sour soup = good.  It's his go-to dish. He liked it. $9.25. (Regular size, they have a small one as well.) 

Shanghai noodles = okay. The flavors were good but the noodles were a bit undercooked. $9.25.

Dry sauteed string beans = awesome. A bit spicy, tangy and sweet. The pickled vegetables were a great addition. Well cooked beans. (I loathe undercooked beans that are squeaky as a result.) $9.50

Service = okay. Basically one person takes the orders, answer the phone, and serves the food.  (More people in the kitchen than in dining area.) Chinese & ESL.  You were warned about the service and ESL.  

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Dinner for 3 came out to $59.15 with leftovers.

Seating = about six 4-tops (might seat 5-6 if you find the chairs) and a few 2-tops. 

This place gets busy. There's a wait list...I guess. We waited around 30 minutes for a table on a Friday evening.   

We'll be back for those sticky spicy wings...saw it on other tables, but our table & bellies were full.

excerpts: Dry sauteed string beans - fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle
These did not taste dry fried at all!
Almost like blanched strings beans mixed in sauce.
So bland!
They got better the next day
dry sauteed string beans.author: Elena N.
dry sauteed string beans.review:
I was craving Xiao long bao and Dry fried chicken wings. I've had Shanghai house bookmarked for some time, so instead of trekking across the park into the Sunset to get my fix, I thought I'd finally check Shanghai house off my list. I called in the take out order and the roommate picked it up about 30 mins later.

Dry chicken wings - chicken wings deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger and roast red peppers
A little sweeter than I prefer. The roommate said it was cuz they use honey instead of corn syrup. Though honey is probably better for you, I prefer a different sweetener as the honey overpowered the savory aspect of the dish.

Xiao long bao
These were delish! The skin held up well in the take out container. None of them burst so they all kept their juicy goodness. I liked the thickness of the wrapper and the consistency of the filling.

Potstickers - pork and veggies
Meh! Average potstickers. Nothing to write home about.

Dry sauteed string beans - fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle
These did not taste dry fried at all! Almost like blanched strings beans mixed in sauce. So bland! They got better the next day but then they got mushy.

House special eggplant - shrimp, chicken and fresh basil
The roommate's pick since he wanted something healthier. I actually liked this dish. Had great flavor and the eggplant was cooked nicely.

Combo fried rice
Burnt! The whole dish tasted burnt. I know sometimes a little smokiness can be good, but not in fried rice and not to this degree! The cook should have known not to serve this. I'm surprised they gave it to us to take home. Probably hoping we wouldn't complain which we didn't so I guess they scored there.

I might come back just for the Xiao long bao, but with Shanghai dumpling king just down the street with better offerings in terms additional dishes, I'll probably skip Shanghai house. No one should be serving burnt rice!

excerpts:
The pork/lettuce dumplings
Dry sauteed string beans - fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle
Dan dan noodles
Tan tan noodles
I like them all.
I can't help to come back.
When I come here with my gf, everything is fine, but when I am by my self, she treated me like crap! 
So, I sing this song for me and who ever had a so bad service in here because the waitress.
dry sauteed string beans.author: Nobu K.
dry sauteed string beans.review:
I know there is a waitress drives you crazy as F!
I understand. But I like the food very much.
Hand cut noodrow pan fly was really good.
Of course the XLB!
The pork/lettuce dumplings
Dry sauteed string beans - fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle
Dan dan noodles
