excerpts: Dry Sauteed String Beans: The flavor was a little bland, but we mixed this with the sauce that came with our chicken wings and it was MUCH better.
dry sauteed string beans.author: Gelene V.
dry sauteed string beans.review:
Came here off a comment that said the chicken wings at Shanghai House was BETTER than San Tung's. Does that even exist? Well that's what we were trying to figure out. 

The restaurant always seems to be a little empty, and at a glance can probably fit ~30 people. 

From their menu, these are the things I have tried before: 

Green Onion Pancake: Both times someone in my group ordered this, and both times the dish disappointed. When it comes out of the kitchen, it's warm and not hot - which makes me think they kept it in the freezer and just heated it up when customers order it. While I know most restaurants do that, it'd be nice if at least they FOOL me into thinking it was freshly made by coming out hot.... 

XLB: not bad, but not great either. If I was really craving XLBs, I'd just walk down the block and visit Dumpling King, sorry. 

Savory Rice Roll: The interior was cold!!!!! Need I say more?

Dry Sauteed String Beans: The flavor was a little bland, but we mixed this with the sauce that came with our chicken wings and it was MUCH better. Perhaps they should make a dish with the string beans solely in the chicken wings sauce (where is the suggestion box when you need it?)

Dry Fried Chicken Wings: Now this is perhaps the ONLY thing I really liked. Some people thought the chicken wings were too battered up or that it was too spicy, but I thought it was PERFECT. And what is also great is that their chicken wings are HUGE! If i were to come back, I'd only order the wings.

excerpts: Does your mouth water at the mere mention of soup dumplings or dry sauteed string beans?
Do you enjoy decent service in clean environment?
The two of us shared an order of XLB, the dry sauteed string beans (#51), and the shanghai noddles.
The first two were exceptionally delicious.
I did note how the noodle of the dumpling was a bit thicker/firmer than Dumpling King's, which was enjoyable.
The sting beans are TDF (to die for)...seriously, that garlicky sauce and delicious peppers...and the beans weren't over cooked.
The low-note were the noodles...
they look a lot better than they actually taste (bland-ish).
dry sauteed string beans.author: Misha F.
dry sauteed string beans.review:
Do you LOVE SDK? Does your mouth water at the mere mention of soup dumplings or dry sauteed string beans? Do you enjoy decent service in clean environment? If so, then this is the place for you.

Since SDK (Shanghai Dumpling King) is closed, I needed an alternative dumpling place after my hour long walk with close friend. Luckily, I yelped dumplings, and this place popped up.

The two of us shared an order of XLB, the dry sauteed string beans (#51), and the shanghai noddles. The first two were exceptionally delicious. I did note how the noodle of the dumpling was a bit thicker/firmer than Dumpling King's, which was enjoyable. The sting beans are TDF (to die for)...seriously, that garlicky sauce and delicious peppers...and the beans weren't over cooked. The low-note were the noodles...they look a lot better than they actually taste (bland-ish). Mix the noodles up in the green bean sauce and add some dollops of srichichcahchcha sauce to save them. 

Anyway...we enjoyed our meal for $26 (inc tip).

excerpts: I can't wait for the dry fried chicken wings and dry sauteed string beans!
And the to-go orders are always so fast!
The lady always forgets to tell me how long it'll take
but I always assume 15 mins, and
dry sauteed string beans.author: Jessie C.
dry sauteed string beans.review:
The bf and I order from here a lot because it's close and it's good. The XLB are juicy, and the shanghai specialties (like stir fried rice cake, the braised bean thread sheet, fresh noodles) are all delicious. We've tried the shanghai style dim sum for lunch before too, and it's also good! This place really hits the spot when I'm craving savoury soy milk, onion pancake, fried dumpling-y bun things, and sticky rice rolls. I just ordered from them right now and am waiting for my takeout order. I can't wait for the dry fried chicken wings and dry sauteed string beans! And the to-go orders are always so fast! The lady always forgets to tell me how long it'll take but I always assume 15 mins, and when I get there it's always ready for me!

But be warned, CASH only! (there's a B of A a block away, though, if that's your bank)

excerpts: Faves include potstickers, vegetarian goose, kung pao prawns and anything else we ever order.
This isnt the place to go for proper, timely service and they don't serve alcohol but you can bring your own!
I often bring my own wine and glasses!!
No Corkage fee... and again, the food rocks.
It's like cornstarch never existed and the only types of vegetables were fresh...
kung pao prawns.author: let's c.
kung pao prawns.review: This is the best Chinese food I have ever eaten. It is fresh and flavorful and the textures are bang on. If you want greasy, heavy Chinese, don't come here. I have brought many different people here and they always love it. Faves include potstickers, vegetarian goose, kung pao prawns and anything else we ever order. This isnt the place to go for proper, timely service and they don't serve alcohol but you can bring your own! I often bring my own wine and glasses!! No Corkage fee... and again, the food rocks. It's like cornstarch never existed and the only types of vegetables were fresh...

excerpts: House special eggplant - shrimp, chicken and fresh basil
The roommate's pick since he wanted something healthier.
I actually liked this dish.
house special eggplant.author: Elena N.
house special eggplant.review:
I was craving Xiao long bao and Dry fried chicken wings. I've had Shanghai house bookmarked for some time, so instead of trekking across the park into the Sunset to get my fix, I thought I'd finally check Shanghai house off my list. I called in the take out order and the roommate picked it up about 30 mins later.

Dry chicken wings - chicken wings deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger and roast red peppers
A little sweeter than I prefer. The roommate said it was cuz they use honey instead of corn syrup. Though honey is probably better for you, I prefer a different sweetener as the honey overpowered the savory aspect of the dish.

Xiao long bao
These were delish! The skin held up well in the take out container. None of them burst so they all kept their juicy goodness. I liked the thickness of the wrapper and the consistency of the filling.

Potstickers - pork and veggies
Meh! Average potstickers. Nothing to write home about.

Dry sauteed string beans - fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle
These did not taste dry fried at all! Almost like blanched strings beans mixed in sauce. So bland! They got better the next day but then they got mushy.

House special eggplant - shrimp, chicken and fresh basil
The roommate's pick since he wanted something healthier. I actually liked this dish. Had great flavor and the eggplant was cooked nicely.

Combo fried rice
Burnt! The whole dish tasted burnt. I know sometimes a little smokiness can be good, but not in fried rice and not to this degree! The cook should have known not to serve this. I'm surprised they gave it to us to take home. Probably hoping we wouldn't complain which we didn't so I guess they scored there.

I might come back just for the Xiao long bao, but with Shanghai dumpling king just down the street with better offerings in terms additional dishes, I'll probably skip Shanghai house. No one should be serving burnt rice!

excerpts: I have never been disappointed with their House Special Eggplant and Sesame Chicken which are staples of our meals here.
house special eggplant.author: Thomas L.
house special eggplant.review:
I have been going here for a few years.  I have never been disappointed with their House Special Eggplant and Sesame Chicken which are staples of our meals here.  

The dining room is small and plain.  The service is ok, borderline slow.

excerpts: I can only report that, in addition to the excellent pompano, the vegetarian goose tastes nothing like goose, and looks even less like goose, but is very tasty, the sesame chicken is one of the best sweet fried preparations of anything I've had, the spareribs are good in a sauce that might be a little bit too rich, and the house special eggplant is excellent.
house special eggplant.author: Spike S.
house special eggplant.review:
At Shanghai House, you get a good meal at a good price.  And it's in a clean restaurant with a clean bathroom, which isn't always true in this part of town.

But first, something to remember before you get there: CASH ONLY.  Fortunately, there is a BoA about four doors down the street, but it's better not to have to run out at the end of the meal to get some cash.

Another thing to know is that there are TWO MENUS.  They may bring you both menus, but you have to look closely because they look almost the same.  If you only have the gringo menu (no jellyfish in the appetizer section is a sure indicator of the gringo menu), ask for the other menu.  And you can call it The Other Menu, this is well understood.

Now why do you want The Other Menu unless you like jellyfish and pig's feet? (I like both, but that's not the point here.)  Maybe because you LIKE FISH.  There's no fish on The Gringo Menu, only on The Other Menu.  And the fried pompano with spicy sauce, is fish worth having.  If you're not used to cooked whole fish, it might be frustrating at first, but it's worth the effort.  My only complaint is that the fish is a bit small.  Afterwards, you have this beautiful fish skeleton with a head and tail, I wish I had brought my camera.

There are other fish dishes and a lot of other dishes on The Other Menu, but I forgot to bring all my relatives so we could try them.  I can only report that, in addition to the excellent pompano, the vegetarian goose tastes nothing like goose, and looks even less like goose, but is very tasty, the sesame chicken is one of the best sweet fried preparations of anything I've had, the spareribs are good in a sauce that might be a little bit too rich, and the house special eggplant is excellent.

The food is incredibly hot when it comes to the table, it's only about forty steps from the wok to the table and the kitchen doesn't have any real staging area (you see it when you go the bathroom), so let it sit before you burn your mouth.  The tea is good and the fortune cookies are fortune cookies.

excerpts: Ordered the Shanghai style pan fried noodles and twice pork and they weren't very impressive.
Both entrees came with a lot of sauce, so I recommend ordering some rice.
twice pork.author: Czarina L.
twice pork.review:
Ordered the Shanghai style pan fried noodles and twice pork and they weren't very impressive. Both entrees came with a lot of sauce, so I recommend ordering some rice. Service was abrupt, but it seems like a busy spot, so don't expect lots of smiles. 

Also prices on the Yelp menu are much cheaper than the actual menu. Most entrees were $8-12, with the exception of cheaper dim sum options (which is more expensive than most places) and pricier seasonal items.

excerpts: We also ordered Mushu Pork (comes with 4 pancakes) and a House Special Shrimp entree (spicy), which both were not bad.
mushu pork.author: Celena C.
mushu pork.review:
Really liked the sheng jian bao here! I would definitely come back to order them again. We also ordered Mushu Pork (comes with 4 pancakes) and a House Special Shrimp entree (spicy), which both were not bad.

Though the food was good, the service was pretty bad. There is only 1 waitress, and she does not seem to care that much about the customers. You have to call her multiple times to get her attention for anything: getting seated, ordering food, getting more water, getting the check, etc. There also is no proper wait list. The waitress just tells people to wait outside.

excerpts: We had the Dry Chicken Wings, Mushu Pork, and Pan Fried Dumplings.
The coating on the chicken is like a hard caramel strengthened by corn starch and the sauce is heavily thickened with honey (do not get this on your clothes!).
The mushu pork dish consisted mainly of onions and eaten together with the bread wrap and sauce was pretty tasty.
The pan fried dumplings were also good - the skin on the bottoms nicely browned and crisp.
Not overly generous with the filling (I'd say about 40%) but the inside is moist and flavorful.
mushu pork.author: Austin L.
mushu pork.review:
Despite warnings about the draconic service, we decided to try this place and managed to get a table at around 7 pm. Five minutes later, the forewarned waitress arrives with menus and the "esteemed" resting b*tch face. The lack of organization in service reminded me of the movie Matilda with Miss Trunchbull - the kitchen chefs (or staff) were so sweet and helpful while the waitress disappeared into the kitchen. 

The food was pretty delicious. We had the Dry Chicken Wings, Mushu Pork, and Pan Fried Dumplings. The coating on the chicken is like a hard caramel strengthened by corn starch and the sauce is heavily thickened with honey (do not get this on your clothes!). The mushu pork dish consisted mainly of onions and eaten together with the bread wrap and sauce was pretty tasty.  The pan fried dumplings were also good - the skin on the bottoms nicely browned and crisp. Not overly generous with the filling (I'd say about 40%) but the inside is moist and flavorful. All leftovers tasted great the next day even reheated. 

On the fence about coming back because having to deal with attitude is kind of a pain when trying to enjoy good food but she kind of softened up by the end of service. Let's not forget that she did give us side-eye at the beginning but stopped after  because I was scrolling through the one-star reviews on the table to her face as we were ordering. Overall, what an experience. For Zagat to review this place so highly and comment so little on the service says a lot about how people view restaurant reviews, doesn't it?

excerpts: DO get the mushu pork with wraps-
it's like a pork wrap.
Stuff the wrap with the amount of meat your desire and eat!
mushu pork.author: Linda N.
mushu pork.review:
But why the low ratings?

This place is small so seating is limited.  Make sure you get here I'd say before 7pm or after 8:15pm.

DO get the bean curd vegetarian dish- something people don't usually order but try it, it's a must.

DO get the meathballs-  these are big juicy balls.  If you like big juicy balls in your mouf, get this.  You won't regret it.

DON'T get the house special noodles- unless it's what you really want.  My bf thought these were the crispy pan fried noodles but nope.  What a fail.

DO get the dry fried chicken wings- better than San Tung.  BETTER THAN SAN TUNG. enough said.

DON'T get the sparerib-  Big slabs of unflavored meat. 

DO get the green onion pancake- nice and crispy, beautifully plated, decent taste.

DO get the mushu pork with wraps- it's like a pork wrap.  Stuff the wrap with the amount of meat your desire and eat!

excerpts: Highly recommend the green beans, pan fried dumplings, Shanghai dumplings and sesame chicken!
sesame chicken.author: Leah A.
sesame chicken.review:
This place is legit! Highly recommend the green beans, pan fried dumplings, Shanghai dumplings and sesame chicken! 

The wings imo were jus average, I would probably not get them again since they are difficult to eat. 

Food is super fresh and comes out pipping hot. Came here with a party of about 5 people and waited about 15-30 minutes for a table at around 8pm on a Saturday. 

It's a tiny place, but I would definitely come back here again!

excerpts: I always come in on a Friday evening every now and then followed by a movie ( Balboa theater across the street) and order the "Handcut noodles" and the "Sesame chicken" and "Shanghai steamed dumplings" sooooooo yummy!
:D
Literally anything you order here is going to taste amazing, fresh and flavorful.
The owner / waitress who comes and takes your order make seem little blunt and off putting but she means well and will bring you exactly what you need and ordered.
This place is CASH only and can have limited seating sometimes.
Other then that this is by far the best place to come and get a great tasty meal!!!!!
sesame chicken.author: Taylor S.
sesame chicken.review: My favorite place to get authentic Chinese food! I always come in on a Friday evening every now and then followed by a movie ( Balboa theater across the street) and order the "Handcut noodles" and the "Sesame chicken" and "Shanghai steamed dumplings" sooooooo yummy! :D Literally anything you order here is going to taste amazing, fresh and flavorful. The owner / waitress who comes and takes your order make seem little blunt and off putting but she means well and will bring you exactly what you need and ordered. This place is CASH only and can have limited seating sometimes. Other then that this is by far the best place to come and get a great tasty meal!!!!!

excerpts: Green onion pancake was good too as well as sesame chicken and stir fried noodles shanghai style
sesame chicken.author: Max K.
sesame chicken.review: Great place for XLB and dry fried chicken wings.  The wings aren't quite as good as San Tung's, in my opinion, but if you're in the Richmond and don't want to cross the park and wait over an hour to get your dry fried chicken wings, this place has got you covered.  The XLBs are well spaced so that they dont stick together and tear while picking them up and taste great.  Green onion pancake was good too as well as sesame chicken and stir fried noodles shanghai style

excerpts: My friend got the sesame chicken which I gladly helped myself to.
It was delicious.
Crunchy and flavorful and very spicy.
I ended mixing some of the sauce with my soup which turned my soup into a great dish too.
Finally we got the veggie dumplings which were decent on its own and with the vinegar but again the magical sesame chicken sauce turned it into a different dish.
One negative is that the food takes forever to come out so make sure you're not hungry or in a hurry when you arrive.
sesame chicken.author: David L.
sesame chicken.review: We stopped in here because everything else in the area seemed dead minus a bar full of smoke. I have no regrets! I got the beef brisket soup. It was good except it wasn't spicy at all which is what I'm used to and was expecting. Still the portion was large and thr brisket juicy and plentiful. My friend got the sesame chicken which I gladly helped myself to. It was delicious. Crunchy and flavorful and very spicy. I ended mixing some of the sauce with my soup which turned my soup into a great dish too. Finally we got the veggie dumplings which were decent on its own and with the vinegar but again the magical sesame chicken sauce turned it into a different dish. One negative is that the food takes forever to come out so make sure you're not hungry or in a hurry when you arrive.

excerpts: I have never been disappointed with their House Special Eggplant and Sesame Chicken which are staples of our meals here.
sesame chicken.author: Thomas L.
sesame chicken.review:
I have been going here for a few years.  I have never been disappointed with their House Special Eggplant and Sesame Chicken which are staples of our meals here.  

The dining room is small and plain.  The service is ok, borderline slow.

excerpts: We didn't branch out and stuck with basic sesame chicken and the sweet & sour chicken, both of which were good.
sesame chicken.author: Katie L.
sesame chicken.review:
After seeing the Shanghai House featured in a San Francisco magazine, my boyfriend and I decided to check it out.  They are known for their dumplings, so be sure to try those!

There's no reservations and the store itself is very small, so make sure you get there early for dinner or super later in order to get a seat! There's no wait list and the only place to wait for a table is outside.  

The service was only okay, we were rarely checked up on for simple things such as water.  The food also took some time to get to us, but was somewhat worth the wait.  It was very authentic and the fried rice was delicious.  We didn't branch out and stuck with basic sesame chicken and the sweet & sour chicken, both of which were good.  The portion size was very large, so you won't leave hungry.  

Note: Cash only!

excerpts: I can only report that, in addition to the excellent pompano, the vegetarian goose tastes nothing like goose, and looks even less like goose, but is very tasty, the sesame chicken is one of the best sweet fried preparations of anything I've had, the spareribs are good in a sauce that might be a little bit too rich, and the house special eggplant is excellent.

Another thing to know is that there are TWO MENUS.  They may bring you both menus, but you have to look closely because they look almost the same.  If you only have the gringo menu (no jellyfish in the appetizer section is a sure indicator of the gringo menu), ask for the other menu.  And you can call it The Other Menu, this is well understood.

excerpts: I ordered sesame chicken for a takeout.
I was enjoying the food very much until I chewed on a meat that has a tiny but hard ROCK inside it....
It scratched one of my teeth really bad now I have to spend my money on a dentist cuz of this...
I really can't imagine myself going back to this place
cuz honestly I'm too scared to go back...
sesame chicken.author: Chris L.
sesame chicken.review: I ordered sesame chicken for a takeout. I was enjoying the food very much until I chewed on a meat that has a tiny but hard ROCK inside it.... It scratched one of my teeth really bad now I have to spend my money on a dentist cuz of this... I really can't imagine myself going back to this place cuz honestly I'm too scared to go back...

excerpts: Our favorite dishes include the dumplings, the pickled vegetables and bean curd sheet, the garlic chicken, the sesame chicken, and the beef vermicelli clay pot.
All the soups with the hand-cut noodles are outstanding.
I hope Shanhai House stays around for a long time.
It changed my perception of Chinese cuisine.
sesame chicken.author: Victoria R.
sesame chicken.review: My boyfriend and I are regulars here.  The food is amazing, especially for the price.  Our favorite dishes include the dumplings, the pickled vegetables and bean curd sheet, the garlic chicken, the sesame chicken, and the beef vermicelli clay pot.  All the soups with the hand-cut noodles are outstanding.  I hope Shanhai House stays around for a long time.  It changed my perception of Chinese cuisine.

excerpts: The Sesame chicken and dried fried chicken wings were way too sweet for my taste.
sesame chicken.author: dj z.
sesame chicken.review:
Wow, the place was incredibly clean, and even though the waitstaff was slow in such a small place, the food was worth it.

The sweet and sour pork was excellent! Flat thinly sliced pieces in a crispy batter, not too heavy or too sweet.

The Sesame chicken and dried fried chicken wings were way too sweet for my taste. The Buddha's Delight veggie combo was awesome, even though it didn't have the customary fried tofu pockets and glass noodles.

Will definitely come here again if I find myself near the beach soon!

excerpts: Shanghai dumplings, sesame chicken, dry chicken wings
(not dry...
i don't understand, but who cares) spicy cold plate combo are my favorites.
CASH
ONLY
sesame chicken.author: James F.
sesame chicken.review: I don't know why it took me so long to find this place. It's not for the ambiance, it's for the food! Shanghai dumplings, sesame chicken, dry chicken wings (not dry... i don't understand, but who cares) spicy cold plate combo are my favorites. CASH ONLY

excerpts: the chinese eggplant, chicken and shrimp dish left me wanting more and the sesame chicken was perfectly crisp and saturated.
the fish and shittake mushrooms (our best guess was some kind of bass) left my mouth humbled, thinking that i had had it better before.
sesame chicken.author: Missniche W.
sesame chicken.review:
wow! yuuuuummmy! 
i couldn't give this place 5 stars and here's why- a tsingtao is always fantastic with a chinese meal and there is no liquor license. also, the single waitress for the restaurant was just not nice. i'm well aware of cultural differences, however service is service and she would not smile, was not attentive, paid  no heed to the order of dishes or amount of space available on the table for food. i also noticed it was not just my table (me being black and my cohorts being caucasian)- but she was equal opportunity cold, withdrawn and indifferent to every table- oh, and ps- there is no life or decoration at shanghai house. i think one plant. luckily my 5 companions were worthy of paying attention only to my immediate surroundings...and the food.

the food was phenomenal! the vegetarian goose ( i AM NOT a vegetarian- far from it!) was amazing. a light tofu and mushroom dish with unexpected delectable flavor. the dumplings were pretty good. not the best i ever had, but better than most. the potstickers were...not good potstickers. more like funny shaped shanghais, crispy on the bottom. the chinese eggplant, chicken and shrimp dish left me wanting more and the sesame chicken was perfectly crisp and saturated. the fish and shittake mushrooms (our best guess was some kind of bass) left my mouth humbled, thinking that i had had it better before. all in all, i will definitely go back and enjoy the food immensely.

i should mention that we brought a 6-pack of brew in and there's no corkage (screwage, whatever)- so if you like a cold beer with your chinese cuisine- do it!

and last but not least, the bill for 6 people who lurrve food and have no shame in saying "another one of those, please" was (drum roll please)...75 bones. yes, shanghai house...your cold and aloof waitress, room devoid of personality, spectacular food and more than accommodating prices have won me over...and i'll be back!

excerpts: I had order the xiao long baos for us, and he ordered garlic chicken for us to share.
The XLBs were sooo tiny & flat looking.
The very few of them that had hot juice in them we accidentally broke & the others didn't have any in it.
Some of them even looked like they already were punctured in the basket before we even touched them.
The garlic chicken was okay, garlicky with some salty brown sauce with some yummy veggies mixed with them.
The 10 teeny XLBs were $5.50, in addition to the garlic chicken, & 3 rice bowls our bill was $17 and change..not cheap!
So far, the best XLBs I've had are from Shanghai Dumpling Shop in Millbrae.
I give it a 2 because the place was clean & I felt bad for the lone waitress having to do pretty much everything in the front.
garlic chicken.author: Cat C.
garlic chicken.review:
My sweetie & I came here before 1:30 yesterday afternoon after we saw a few people sticking out of the door waiting at Shanghai Dumpling King and told me he just wanted to eat something and stop driving.  I read some of the reviews while we were looking for parking but was expecting a little more.  I had order the xiao long baos for us, and he ordered garlic chicken for us to share.  The XLBs were sooo tiny & flat looking.  The very few of them that had hot juice in them we accidentally broke & the others didn't have any in it.  Some of them even looked like they already were punctured in the basket before we even touched them.  The garlic chicken was okay, garlicky with some salty brown sauce with some yummy veggies mixed with them.  

The place is tiny and there was only one waitress, so service was slow, in fact she sometimes had some people from the kitchen helping her bring dishes to customers. Eww, nasty..I saw her a few times rubbing her nose with the top of her hand, at least it wasn't with her palms or fingers though but still!  For every table that left there were more customers waiting to sit there...and she'd quickly set up their table settings.  Maybe they originally wanted SDK too.     

The 10 teeny XLBs were $5.50, in addition to the garlic chicken, & 3 rice bowls our bill was $17 and change..not cheap!  So far, the best XLBs I've had are from Shanghai Dumpling Shop in Millbrae.  I give it a 2 because the place was clean & I felt bad for the lone waitress having to do pretty much everything in the front.

excerpts: Our favorite dishes include the dumplings, the pickled vegetables and bean curd sheet, the garlic chicken, the sesame chicken, and the beef vermicelli clay pot.
All the soups with the hand-cut noodles are outstanding.
I hope Shanhai House stays around for a long time.
It changed my perception of Chinese cuisine.
garlic chicken.author: Victoria R.
garlic chicken.review: My boyfriend and I are regulars here.  The food is amazing, especially for the price.  Our favorite dishes include the dumplings, the pickled vegetables and bean curd sheet, the garlic chicken, the sesame chicken, and the beef vermicelli clay pot.  All the soups with the hand-cut noodles are outstanding.  I hope Shanhai House stays around for a long time.  It changed my perception of Chinese cuisine.

excerpts: We also ordered the Dried Fried Garlic Chicken Wings which were awesome!
I loved the sweet and spicy flavor with a hint of basil that coated each chicken wing.
The chicken wings were fried to a perfect crunchy texture.
garlic chicken.author: Lang T.
garlic chicken.review:
My boyfriend took me here after I had a dream about dumplings and these were as good as the ones in my dreams. The outer skin was a perfect and complemented the creamy texture of the meat perfectly. The dumplings come with a vinegar and ginger dipping sauce. The only sad thing about this meal was that not all the dumplings had soup in them. This inconsistency was disappointing until we went to Dumpling King a few blocks away and all their dumplings were soup-less. Compared to Dumpling King I would rather have Shanghai House dumplings. 

We also ordered the Dried Fried Garlic Chicken Wings which were awesome! I loved the sweet and spicy flavor with a hint of basil that coated each chicken wing. The chicken wings were fried to a perfect crunchy texture. I would totally order this dish again for sure!!

The service was pretty decent considering that there was only one person serving us and consistent flow of people coming in. The price is pretty reasonable. 10 dumplings for $5.50 and the chicken wings were about $7 for 10 wings. For sure Shanghai House would be my place to go for dumplings.

excerpts: We had Garlic Chicken which was real good and Mogolian beef which was actuall good and Veggie fried rice which was not oily.
Everything was really good.
The Place is small
but I always like that about a restaurant.
The customers were very Diversed which I also like.
The waitress was nice.
We will deifenlty go back there more often.
We will need to get there a bit earlyer
so we can look at the menu better.
I think this is the best spot we have near our house for chinese food.
We ordered 3 items and only spent like 23 bucks which is cool.
Yeah!!!!!
garlic chicken.author: Ge I.
garlic chicken.review: We went to this place yesturday night for Dinner. It was almost 9:30pm, that's when they close but they sat us down. The tables were really nice. looks very expensive. The menu is also big. They gave us two menu. They have Dim Sum not allot but good amount. We had Garlic Chicken which was real good and Mogolian beef which was actuall good and Veggie fried rice which was not oily. Everything was really good. The Place is small but I always like that about a restaurant. The customers were very Diversed which I also like. The waitress was nice. We will deifenlty go back there more often. We will need to get there a bit earlyer so we can look at the menu better. I think this is the best spot we have near our house for chinese food. We ordered 3 items and only spent like 23 bucks which is cool. Yeah!!!!!

excerpts: The tea smoked duck was incredibly smokey...maybe too much so.
Dumplings were juicy.
Noodles were saucy.
Pan fried dumplings had a super seared bottom which some like
tea smoked duck.author: Julie L.
tea smoked duck.review:
Can the guy who works there be any friendlier? He's so nice!

Food was ok and wasn't laden w/ MSG. The tea smoked duck was incredibly smokey...maybe too much so. Dumplings were juicy. Noodles were saucy. Pan fried dumplings had a super seared bottom which some like but I found just stuck to my teeth. 

Didn't find any standout dishes but it wasn't bad.

excerpts: The tea smoked duck was good and as fatty as ducks come, and came with four plain buns.
I don't like fat, but I do love crispy skin, so I patiently removed the fat and savored the rest.
tea smoked duck.author: Vivian H.
tea smoked duck.review:
One unfortunate Saturday involving an older woman who can't drive resulted in a house with no water for 8 hours.  EIGHT hours, that's how long it takes the city of San Francisco to fix a pipe that provides water to dozens of families.

No water = no toilet use, showers, washing hands, etc.. and no cooking.  No cooking = a good reason to dine out.

The bf had been wanting shanghai dumplings for awhile, and my visit to Shanghai Dumpling King six blocks up from this place wasn't too great.  My friend said Shanghai House is her FAVORITE place for the dumplings so I decided to try it.

The place is definitely cleaner and more spacious than Shanghai Dumpling King.  The service was poor.. it took awhile to get menus and tea and for the waitress to even notice that we were ready to order.

The Shanghai dumplings were a little better than Shanghai Dumpling King.  The wrapper is thicker and none of them popped.  Every single drop of the soup went into my mouth.  Mmmm.

The tea smoked duck was good and as fatty as ducks come, and came with four plain buns.  I don't like fat, but I do love crispy skin, so I patiently removed the fat and savored the rest.  A little salty, but tasty.

The handcut noodles were a big no.  EXTREMELY greasy and tasted like chow fun.  It didn't look appetizing, and it wasn't.

Overall OK, but not good enough for me to come back.

excerpts: The claypot vermicelli and the tea smoked duck are a must have for any visit as I have not seen it on any other Shanghai menu.
tea smoked duck.author: Candy C.
tea smoked duck.review:
This place is depressing. Its small, its quiet and the music they play sometimes makes you want to cry. But the food makes you forget about life and say to yourself, it is going to be okay ;)

Shanghai House popped my shanghai dumpling cherry, and for that reason, it will always have a special place in my heart. I have searched high and low for another Shanghai restaurant for things equally as good as the menu here and I always come home to the outter richmond. Never mind the fact no freeway exits take you there or that you need to travel 20 minutes within the city to make it there. This is where my heart lies.

The claypot vermicelli and the tea smoked duck are a must have for any visit as I have not seen it on any other Shanghai menu. Do not order from the sucker menu (you'll spot it fast - its the one with sweet and sour pork and broccoli beef). You're in a Shanghai restaurant. Order Shanghai food.

excerpts: I never had tea smoked duck before and thought it was pretty good here.
There's a great smokiness to the dish you can smell and taste.
Duck doesn't have a lot of meat to begin with
so this isn't a huge meat dish
but it's crispy, and
the taste kind reminds me of ham.
tea smoked duck.author: Daniel L.
tea smoked duck.review:
This is one of the few reasons for me to go to the far Outer Richmond. It's a small place that may require a wait. Parking may be somewhat of a pain as well. But there are some great dishes here comparable to Sang Tung if you are a fan of that restaraunt.

The dried fried chicken wings are very similar to San Tung but it is less sweet and spicier. The chicken is still crispy and saucy at the same time, however they do look a lot darker. And probably what makes it spicy is the fact that the chicken is coated in chili pepper seeds as well.

I never had tea smoked duck before and thought it was pretty good here. There's a great smokiness to the dish you can smell and taste. Duck doesn't have a lot of meat to begin with so this isn't a huge meat dish but it's crispy, and the taste kind reminds me of ham. The duck also comes with some steamed buns and hoisin sauce to eat it like peiking duck during banquets if you wish.

The xiao long bao is not has soupy as I was expecting. There is no lettuce cooked with it as well. But given that, I think this was one of the better places I have had it in SF. Not too much wrap and the pork was cooked well.

The dried fried string beans are still firm and not over cooked till they're mushy. And there is a good wok flavor with it. The rice cake is also pretty good as well and worth a try.

I would  recommend a try here. It is not perfect but they do many dishes right. Definitely earned a spot in my rotation of SF Chinese restaraunts.

excerpts: And then to show that I am also a sucker for some meats, I also highly recommend the Tea Smoked Duck.
It's so delicious!
tea smoked duck.author: Liza B.
tea smoked duck.review:
Why anyone would rate this great little place less than 4 stars is a mystery to me--perhaps they ordered the wrong things or maybe they came from outside this neighborhood...Yes I guess if I bussed, biked or drove over here from the Mission, I would probably not give it 5 stars, but this yummy, inexpensive restaurant is in MY neighborhood where good restaurants are far outnumbered by really, really dismal ones. 

My first favorite restaurant in this stretch has always been Miki's right next door...but now I have TWO new favorites on Balboa. Yu Zen and Shanghai House. 

What did I eat there that made me this excited? Well, the first thing I tried, I ate four or five times before I moved on to anything else and that was the Kung Pao chicken. I tried only that partly because I liked it so much, partly because I got it at least 4 times to go--you can't order from the "Shanghai" menu on take out orders--and partly because if you order two orders + rice for two you can feed 4 people (take out) for $20! And that's eating really stand-out Kung Pao--smoky peppers and smoked tofu, lots of veggies (mostly zucchini but it's good here) and tasty chicken. Just right. 

My interest in Chinese Food in my neighborhood (exception of all exceptions: Ton Kiang for brunch) has seriously waned ~ it seemed every time I went for Chinese the last  few years I ate something that was too greasy, too sweet or just not memorable. 

Talk about memorable! the Shanghai style Vegetable Soup with hand cut noodles I had here last weekend has been stuck in my savory, sensory memory ever since and I just can't shake it. Out of all three dishes I ate that meal (my friend and I were hungry and determined to sample more of the menu) the said soup was actually the least "exciting" dish,  but for some reason it's the one that won out as top memorable sense that I can still "taste". I was actually most "excited" about the Bok Choy with Wheat Gluten Dumplings. This was amazingly good and yummy with a delicious sauce soaking the dumplings and the perfectly sized baby bok choy (you don't have to make a slippery slimy fool of yourself with these as you do with typically sized bok choy). Plus I am a sucker for really yummy "meat alternatives". 

And then to show that I am also a sucker for some meats, I also highly recommend the Tea Smoked Duck. It's so delicious! and for someone like me who doesn't eat meat other than poultry or fish, Duck prepared like this is as tasty and decadent as any pork dish might be (read: fatty and delicious and crispy).

So yes, you should try this place. But make sure you look at the Shanghai Menu. it's a mysterious practice they have of only giving it to you with the other menu (straight american chinese food?)--so some people may never even see it (esp. if you order take out)

update: since this review I've tried a few other notable dishes: the Vegetarian Goose (with shitake mushrooms) is delicious as are the Vegetarian Steamed Dumplings. The Mu Shu Vegetables were just right, too. The Vegetable Soup with hand-cut noodles wasn't as exciting as the first time I had it, but that happens sometimes ; ) Obviously plenty for a vegetarian to eat, although I'm not vegetairian. 

update #2: Now that I eat all meat, I can rate the Shanghai pork dumplings too--more delicate and nicer than the (notorious) ones up the street. And the Golden Prawns are my new favorite dish! Yum Yum

update #3: for some reason, after all of these years, I had never ordered the chicken wings until sometime the end of this last year. Oh my! Now it's the new 'must have' --hot, spicy, sweet, crunchy--it's a meal and dessert all at once. Leftovers that we have been known to fight over the next day ("hey you took two pieces!") Chicken crack.

excerpts: The Tea Smoked Duck with dumplings is really, REALLY good.
I was close to saying the hell with family style, I got mines -- but I restrained myself just enough to make it look like I wasn't getting the lion's share.
tea smoked duck.author: Karsten P.
tea smoked duck.review:
The Tea Smoked Duck with dumplings is really, REALLY good. I was close to saying the hell with family style, I got mines -- but I restrained myself just enough to make it look like I wasn't getting the lion's share. The skin was just a bit crisp and the meat was tender and perfectly done, with a subtle smoky flavor that combined really well with the dumplings' hint of sweetness.

I also liked the Green Onion Pancakes (light and moist) and the Mu Shu Pork (one person disagreed, saying they taste burnt, but I loved that the cabbage still had some crunch in it). Service was perfunctory at first but the woman running the floor warmed up as we went: I got a beautiful smile when I asked for a to go menu. She even folded it for me :-)

excerpts: We really enjoyed the tea smoked duck and rice cakes.
The wintermelon soup is also good
but I know that I can make it at home for like a fraction of the price.
tea smoked duck.author: Jacquee P.
tea smoked duck.review:
Cheap eats in a sparse and clean space.

We really enjoyed the tea smoked duck and rice cakes. The wintermelon soup is also good but I know that I can make it at home for like a fraction of the price. The dry fried chicken wings weren't as tasty as expected and the dumplings were nice but not out of this world.

I am used to eating Cantonese style Chinese food and this was a nice diversion from the usual. 

I like how the dining room is just that. It's so small that every inch of the front of the house is used for seating customers. And the customer base makes it feel like you're in someone house. I saw a woman feed her elderly mother at dinner and it was just so sweet.

excerpts: i love duck, but their tea smoked duck was dry, salty and
i was pretty sure that i ate the whole plate without biting into a single piece of meat.
just fat.
the poor thing was probably caught before its first migration because it's obvious it had never worked a single muscle in its entire life.
the green onion pancake was crunchier than the ones you find elsewhere
and i liked it.
the shanghai rice cakes was a little bland, but it's not drenched in oil.
as for the xaio long bao, it was tasty
tea smoked duck.author: Andrew P.
tea smoked duck.review:
small space, clean and bright.  the room filled up around 6:30 on a weeknight, but there was no line and the turnaround time for tables was rather quick, especially considering there was only one lady working up front.

i love duck, but their tea smoked duck was dry, salty and i was pretty sure that i ate the whole plate without biting into a single piece of meat.  just fat.  the poor thing was probably caught before its first migration because it's obvious it had never worked a single muscle in its entire life.  the green onion pancake was crunchier than the ones you find elsewhere and i liked it.  the shanghai rice cakes was a little bland, but it's not drenched in oil.  as for the xaio long bao, it was tasty but i've had better. 

they have no vinegar available on their spice tray and i have a little beef with that.  don't call me petty - that thing is like our ketchup.

excerpts:
We ordered:

- Xiaolongbao (soup dumplings)
- Stir-Fried Shanghai Noodles
- Dry Chicken Wings
- Pan Fried Dumpling
- Pan Fried Potstickers

Food was delicious!
The Pan Fried Dumplings and the Pan Fried Potstickers had a nice crispy, yet chewy exterior.
Both of the fillings were tasty, as well.
Out of the three, my favorite was the Pan Fried Dumplings.
The Stir-Fried Shanghai Noodles were okay
, nothing really made it stand out though.
Lastly, the Dry Chicken Wings were excellent!
Some say it's comparable to San Tung's wings, but honestly they're incomparable.
It's not horrible, it's just different in looks and taste, so one cannot simply compare the two.
The wings here have a nice crunch to them with a sweet caramelized sugar glazing.
dry chicken wings.author: Julia L.
dry chicken wings.review:
The wait can be long and the service is the bare minimum, but the food is awesome!

This is my second time here and both times I've had good experiences. The first time around I remember I had to wait a bit to be seated, but this time my party and I got seated immediately. The same individual (I assume is the owner) took our orders. Both times, this individual did not show much emotions or expressions, she just took our orders, refilled our tea pot from time to time, and that was about it. Food was delivered directly by the chefs.

We ordered:

- Xiaolongbao (soup dumplings)
- Stir-Fried Shanghai Noodles
- Dry Chicken Wings
- Pan Fried Dumpling
- Pan Fried Potstickers

Food was delicious! The Xiaolongbao had a thin exterior that held the soup fairly well and had a juicy filling. The Pan Fried Dumplings and the Pan Fried Potstickers had a nice crispy, yet chewy exterior. Both of the fillings were tasty, as well. Out of the three, my favorite was the Pan Fried Dumplings. The Stir-Fried Shanghai Noodles were okay, nothing really made it stand out though. Lastly, the Dry Chicken Wings were excellent! Some say it's comparable to San Tung's wings, but honestly they're incomparable. It's not horrible, it's just different in looks and taste, so one cannot simply compare the two. The wings here have a nice crunch to them with a sweet caramelized sugar glazing. Not to mention, the size of the wings are generous.

Overall, a great Shanghainese restaurant on Balboa. Parking can be a hassle in the area and the service isn't particularly outstanding, but food definitely hits the spot!

PS: All photos were taken by the bf since I was too busy eating (he takes better photos than me anyway).

excerpts: We had the Dry Chicken Wings, Mushu Pork, and Pan Fried Dumplings.
The coating on the chicken is like a hard caramel strengthened by corn starch and the sauce is heavily thickened with honey (do not get this on your clothes!).
The mushu pork dish consisted mainly of onions and eaten together with the bread wrap and sauce was pretty tasty.
The pan fried dumplings were also good - the skin on the bottoms nicely browned and crisp.
Not overly generous with the filling (I'd say about 40%) but the inside is moist and flavorful.
dry chicken wings.author: Austin L.
dry chicken wings.review:
Despite warnings about the draconic service, we decided to try this place and managed to get a table at around 7 pm. Five minutes later, the forewarned waitress arrives with menus and the "esteemed" resting b*tch face. The lack of organization in service reminded me of the movie Matilda with Miss Trunchbull - the kitchen chefs (or staff) were so sweet and helpful while the waitress disappeared into the kitchen. 

The food was pretty delicious. We had the Dry Chicken Wings, Mushu Pork, and Pan Fried Dumplings. The coating on the chicken is like a hard caramel strengthened by corn starch and the sauce is heavily thickened with honey (do not get this on your clothes!). The mushu pork dish consisted mainly of onions and eaten together with the bread wrap and sauce was pretty tasty.  The pan fried dumplings were also good - the skin on the bottoms nicely browned and crisp. Not overly generous with the filling (I'd say about 40%) but the inside is moist and flavorful. All leftovers tasted great the next day even reheated. 

On the fence about coming back because having to deal with attitude is kind of a pain when trying to enjoy good food but she kind of softened up by the end of service. Let's not forget that she did give us side-eye at the beginning but stopped after  because I was scrolling through the one-star reviews on the table to her face as we were ordering. Overall, what an experience. For Zagat to review this place so highly and comment so little on the service says a lot about how people view restaurant reviews, doesn't it?

excerpts: My family comes here for the dry chicken wings.
Food is delicious.
Some dishes are overly salty... too much msg?
The service isn't the greatest but the food makes up for it.
Depending on the day and time you come... sometimes there's wait because there's only a handful of tables.
dry chicken wings.author: Karina L.
dry chicken wings.review: My family comes here for the dry chicken wings. Food is delicious. Some dishes are overly salty... too much msg? The service isn't the greatest but the food makes up for it. Depending on the day and time you come... sometimes there's wait because there's only a handful of tables.

excerpts: Dry chicken wings - chicken wings deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger and roast red peppers
A little sweeter than I prefer.
The roommate said it was cuz they use honey instead of corn syrup.
dry chicken wings.author: Elena N.
dry chicken wings.review:
I was craving Xiao long bao and Dry fried chicken wings. I've had Shanghai house bookmarked for some time, so instead of trekking across the park into the Sunset to get my fix, I thought I'd finally check Shanghai house off my list. I called in the take out order and the roommate picked it up about 30 mins later.

Dry chicken wings - chicken wings deep fried in batter with garlic, ginger and roast red peppers
A little sweeter than I prefer. The roommate said it was cuz they use honey instead of corn syrup. Though honey is probably better for you, I prefer a different sweetener as the honey overpowered the savory aspect of the dish.

Xiao long bao
These were delish! The skin held up well in the take out container. None of them burst so they all kept their juicy goodness. I liked the thickness of the wrapper and the consistency of the filling.

Potstickers - pork and veggies
Meh! Average potstickers. Nothing to write home about.

Dry sauteed string beans - fresh green beans flash fried and tossed in a garlicky sauce with Chinese pickle
These did not taste dry fried at all! Almost like blanched strings beans mixed in sauce. So bland! They got better the next day but then they got mushy.

House special eggplant - shrimp, chicken and fresh basil
The roommate's pick since he wanted something healthier. I actually liked this dish. Had great flavor and the eggplant was cooked nicely.

Combo fried rice
Burnt! The whole dish tasted burnt. I know sometimes a little smokiness can be good, but not in fried rice and not to this degree! The cook should have known not to serve this. I'm surprised they gave it to us to take home. Probably hoping we wouldn't complain which we didn't so I guess they scored there.

I might come back just for the Xiao long bao, but with Shanghai dumpling king just down the street with better offerings in terms additional dishes, I'll probably skip Shanghai house. No one should be serving burnt rice!

excerpts: We always order the dry chicken wings and xlb.
These 2 have never failed us and these wings are comparable to San tung.
I like these wings because I like the pepper addition.
But, anyway order the xiao long bao and the dry chicken wings !
dry chicken wings.author: Lyra C.
dry chicken wings.review:
This place is CASH ONLY.

I'm pretty much a regular here. Any time someone wants xlb I suggest this place. I come with my tennis guys so we order at least 3 racks of xlb. Yum! We always order the dry chicken wings and xlb. These 2 have never failed us and these wings are comparable to San tung. I like these wings because I like the pepper addition. Its much more flavorful to me. 

Service can be a little slow though because its a mom and pop shop. But I think the two items that I mentioned are worth the wait. We've also ordered the sizzling rice soup and eel noodles. sizzling rice soup was not on the menu but you have to ask. Its pretty good. The eel noodles were okay... I've ordered a number of things so its hard to review them all. But, anyway order the xiao long bao and the dry chicken wings !

excerpts: *Dry chicken wings: so freakin' good.
Definitely echo the "better than San Tung's" sentiment.
Really gratuitous (I only ate an entire dish by myself and felt like I would physically suffer afterwards), but a GREAT choice if you're wanting some decadence.
*Lion's head meatballs: light and fluffy!
Not sure how they get the consistency to be this way, but actually a refreshing (rather than heavy) meat dish.
Soup dumplings: solid.
dry chicken wings.author: Shendi X.
dry chicken wings.review:
Despite the often lackluster service, I do love this place, and am glad I live close by! Authentic Chinese, and so many options. Here's what we've had so far:

*Spicy beef tendon: I've had better. Would pass. Kinda oily, and not that flavorful?
*Dry chicken wings: so freakin' good. Definitely echo the "better than San Tung's" sentiment. Really gratuitous (I only ate an entire dish by myself and felt like I would physically suffer afterwards), but a GREAT choice if you're wanting some decadence.
*Lion's head meatballs: light and fluffy! Not sure how they get the consistency to be this way, but actually a refreshing (rather than heavy) meat dish.
*Soup dumplings: solid. Always delicious.

Looking forward to trying so much more of the menu!

excerpts: If you really dig the dry chicken wings and San Tung's line is too long, try Chang's Kitchen, which is across the street from San Tung.
dry chicken wings.author: Fiona C.
dry chicken wings.review:
I'm pretty sure I entered the establishment and ordered a good 5 minutes before this other party BUT WHERE THE HELL IS MY FOOD & XLB? 

Right now, I see that the other party ordered 2 XLB, whereas my mother and I only ordered 1 XLB, but in what world does a party, who orders later, gets their food first???? LIKE BRUH. 

if you really want good xiao long bao, go to Dumpling Kitchen on Taraval- at least they have good service there. 

If you really dig the dry chicken wings and San Tung's line is too long, try Chang's Kitchen, which is across the street from San Tung. 

Stop giving this place more credit than it deserves. This place is not worth a detour.

excerpts: I would say the best dish is the dry chicken wings!
They are very similar to san tung's famous chicken wings, but I will swear they are better!
For one thing, the chicken they use here consist of wings and drumsticks!
The chicken pieces are also big and they do not skimp!
Each dish consist of 8 pieces of chicken.
The sweet and spicy flavors come together great with the sauce.
dry chicken wings.author: Josie L.
dry chicken wings.review:
A great hole in the wall!  I've been here more than a couple times. Since the place is so small, you kind of never know if there's gonna be a wait or not, but in most days and nights, a wait shouldn't be more than 10-30 minutes if you're coming with a small party (2-4 people)

I would say the best dish is the dry chicken wings! They are very similar to san tung's famous chicken wings, but I will swear they are better!  For one thing, the chicken they use here consist of wings and drumsticks! The chicken pieces are also big and they do not skimp!  Each dish consist of 8 pieces of chicken. The sweet and spicy flavors come together great with the sauce. I would say it taste a bit more on the spicy side compare to san tung. 

I honestly recommend you eat here if you've heard great things about these famous san tung chicken wings. come on, this place usually has minimum wait and I would choose this place over waiting at San tung for 1 hour+!!

Shanghai dumplings - always has the brothy soup inside each dumpling! Pretty delicious and a good amount of pork in each dumpling. They do not fail on the soup inside! The trick is to use your spoon and directly transport from chopstick to spoon ASAP! However, the skin on the dumplings are thick compared to shanghai dumpling king up the street. These are satisfying but definitely not my go to for dumplings. The better part is less wait than up the block and it will still satisfy your craving.


Shanghai style rice cake - great ingredients with a good amount of pork, cabbage and rice cake but really lacks flavor! It was not salty at all and I had to add soy sauce. I usually never do this at any restaurant cause the flavor from the meats with already added salt and soy sauce should do the trick.

Hand-cut shanghai noodles - same concept as the rice cake but with their hand cut noodles. Hand cut noodles had a good texture, but this noodle dish also lacked salt and flavor!  They can definitely improve on this.

Green onion pancake - delicious, crispy and a good amount of green onion! 

pan fried baos - prob the best dish after the chicken wings and dumplings =)  highly recommend!!!!

The best part is that these dishes do not kill your pockets. If you're ballin on a budget and want some good eats, come here!

warning though: service is super slow, so pro-tip.... once you sit down, order right away!

excerpts: Ordered dry chicken wings, tea duck, XLB, Seafood soup, and wine/sesame balls for dessert.
Came out to be about $60 for 2 people.
We definitely ordered too much.
The wings were yummy, super crunchy and tasty.
XLB was ok, a bit small.
The tea duck was really salty, it needed the steamed bun or rice to bring down the saltiness.
The wine/sesame ball soup was a bit weird
so I only ate the sesame balls.
The soup, it was loaded with rice wine, enough for a quick buzz.
dry chicken wings.author: S F.
dry chicken wings.review: Ordered dry chicken wings, tea duck, XLB, Seafood soup, and wine/sesame balls for dessert.  Came out to be about $60 for 2 people.  We definitely ordered too much.  The wings were yummy, super crunchy and tasty.   XLB was ok, a bit small.  The tea duck was really salty, it needed the steamed bun or rice to bring down the saltiness.  The wine/sesame ball soup was a bit weird so I only ate the sesame balls.  The soup, it was loaded with rice wine, enough for a quick buzz.

excerpts: The dry chicken wings are still better than San Tung's IMO along with the friends I was with
So definitely get those!
dry chicken wings.author: Ling H.
dry chicken wings.review:
Another update: Been back several times since my last update and it's become a favorite for me in the city. We got lucky on this cold Saturday night, but we got front row parking. Whaaaaaaaaat. Food tasted really good, but unfortunately, everything wasn't piping hot like it usually is. 

Service was a little slow so I wouldn't come here if you were in a time crunch. There's only one lady that takes your order and understands English.

The dry chicken wings are still better than San Tung's IMO along with the friends I was with :) So definitely get those!

excerpts: Dry chicken wings - Doesn't look too appetizing..
I highly recommend getting this along with the noodles and dry chicken wings!
dry chicken wings.author: Anne T.
dry chicken wings.review:
My favorite foodie friend from SoCal suggested we go to Shanghai house since there are no great places you can get dim sum in LA.. She's been craving dumplings and needed to satisfy her craving before she left town again. I was running a little late, so she went ahead and placed the order for the following:

Pan cut noodles - Must get these! So yummy! I wish I could have this after a drunken night on the town. 

Dry chicken wings - Doesn't look too appetizing.. But these chicken wings are probably just as good as San Tung's but crispier and spicier!

Shanghai dumplings - I can see why she wanted these. So delicious!!!

Pork & vegetables pot-stickers - These tasted good as well. But I would have liked another order of the Shanghai Dumplings!

Stir-fried eggplant - this dish was good. It wasn't a stand out but definitely a good side dish. 

Mongolian beef - This dish was extra spicy! The kick basically took me out for awhile!

Green beans - Wow. What a simple yet crispy, refreshingly crunchy! Not the usual overcooked green beans you get. I highly recommend getting this along with the noodles and dry chicken wings!

Enjoy!

excerpts: Also enjoyed their dry chicken wings, super crispy and covered in thick sweet and spicy sauce.
Damn son.
dry chicken wings.author: Sajira A.
dry chicken wings.review: Had an intense craving for xiao long boa and this place hit the spot. Also enjoyed their dry chicken wings, super crispy and covered in thick sweet and spicy sauce. Damn son.

excerpts:
Dry chicken wings are so delicious!
Bean curd puff-outstanding.
Shanghai dumplings-mmmmmmmmm
We moved away last year, our first & last stop (with many visits in between) when we are in town!
dry chicken wings.author: Emily D.
dry chicken wings.review:
Love Shanghai House!
Dry chicken wings are so delicious!
Bean curd puff-outstanding.
Shanghai dumplings-mmmmmmmmm
We moved away last year, our first & last stop (with many visits in between) when we are in town!

excerpts: Because there is so much ingoing and outgoing traffic, my teeth would have been chattering if not for the dry chicken wings.
As of all Chinese restaurants, waitresses do not engage you in banter.
They jot down your order, bring it to you and try to get you to leave as soon as possible.
There is not even the slightest hint of a smile.
dry chicken wings:
I've had the original dry chicken wings at San Tungs
and I will say these are delicious and just a small notch below the original innovators.
These dry chicken wings were spicy.

In addition, they arrived piping hot, and because I was too hungry to wait for them to cool, I alternated between blowing the chicken, taking a bite, and blowing my fingers to alleviate the minor 3rd degree burns being afflicted upon them.
While an order of San Tung's wings are more in quantity, Shanghai House's wings are much bigger.
There is more meat on these wings.
dry chicken wings.author: Brian V.
dry chicken wings.review:
Shanghai dumplings is my most recent discovery.  There is something magical about these nearly transparent skinned XLB (code for these dumplings I have picked up from reading fellow yelpers); when I wash up in the shower and gingerly soap the sacs, I sometimes picture twin XLB's hanging.   Eating these dumplings take years and years of experience and practice.  The science of it is it is delicately picking it up by its foreskin cleanly, as to not let any juices leak, plopping it into soy sauce, then laying it on your tongue and sliding it into your mouth.  I have had Shanghai Dumpling King nearby which was pretty good, however KDer told me that Shanghai House had dumplings that were renown and comparable if not better.  I could eat 3-4 treys of XLB's at Shanghai Dumpling King so I was hesitant if anything else could compare.  

This place is always crowded.  Unlike Shanghai Dumpling King which is a dump, this place is somewhat modern.  There is even a glass door.  However, beware of this aesthetic beauty.  It does not close completely, and any gust of wind will jar it open, letting in a cold draft of pneumonia.  Because there is so much ingoing and outgoing traffic, my teeth would have been chattering if not for the dry chicken wings.  As of all Chinese restaurants, waitresses do not engage you in banter.  They jot down your order, bring it to you and try to get you to leave as soon as possible.  There is not even the slightest hint of a smile.  We ordered:  

1.  xiao long bao: 4/5  These shanghai dumplings were good, however, inferior to that of Shanghai Dumpling King.  First off, the outside dough was a little too thick as opposed to the nearly translucent skin of Dumpling King.  As a result, it was a little heavier to eat and fills you up faster.  A plus is that because of a thicker outer skin, they are less apt to break, spilling out succulent juices.  These dumplings are also very small, so while there are 10 mini bundles of joy, you can chow through them pretty fast.

2.  pork dumplings: 3/5  These pork dumplings were shaped differently from the original baos.  These were decent.  Again, the dough exterior was thicker than I would have liked.  The pork was tasty inside, however, nothing was truly outstanding.  It was an average dish.

3.  shanghai panfry noodles: 3/5  This was a KDer dish and she made sure to get it vegetarian, stripping the order of its meat.  Curse her.  The noodles were very greasy.  In addition, I am not a fan of those really thick noodles.  I prefer the thin chow mein type noodles.  We ordered too much so I really didn't eat eat much of this until the next day.  It was good as a instant lunch, however, I believe it was more a product of my hunger than to the testament of the noodles.  A pile of oil and grease rested on my plate after the noodles were gone.

4.  dry chicken wings: 5/5  I've had the original dry chicken wings at San Tungs and I will say these are delicious and just a small notch below the original innovators.  These dry chicken wings were spicy.  In addition, they arrived piping hot, and because I was too hungry to wait for them to cool, I alternated between blowing the chicken, taking a bite, and blowing my fingers to alleviate the minor 3rd degree burns being afflicted upon them.  While an order of San Tung's wings are more in quantity, Shanghai House's wings are much bigger.  There is more meat on these wings.  The caramelized sauce is too money and this dish made the meal.  

Shanghai House is affordable like 99.9% of Chinese restaurants, however, they do jack their price an extra dollar or two due to all the media hoopla they have received.  They proudly paste their accolades on the glass window.  I am not the biggest fan of Chinese food.  As I have said countless times, I believe their food to be overly sauced and greasy.  In addition, service is non-existant but you cannot hold a Chinese restaurant to that standard.  If you are tired of waiting in line for San Tungs tho, come here.  To be honest, I can't say San Tung is a clear cut favorite.  These wings can hold San Tung wings' jock.

excerpts:
I ordered:

- Shanghai Soup Dumplings from their Appetizer menu
- Combination Fried Rice 
- Dry Chicken Wings
- 2 coke sodas

and
dry chicken wings.author: Frugal C.
dry chicken wings.review:
I go to this area in the outer richmond a lot and after seeing all the great reviews for this place, I decided to give it a try.  It's a very small place with only a few tables so I would NOT go in large groups of more than 4.  I went around 330pm on Friday and it's best to go at this time or earlier since there is NO waiting line.  In fact, there were only 2 other tables that were being served.  (Also, it's best to go when they open since they have lunch specials at cheaper prices available from 11am-3pm.)  I ordered:

- Shanghai Soup Dumplings from their Appetizer menu
- Combination Fried Rice 
- Dry Chicken Wings
- 2 coke sodas

and if you fill up your tummy real fast like me, that's ALL you should be ordering.  They give you a generous plate of each.  I have to back up what others say about the service -  you have to be aggressive about wanting to order from your menu, paying, wanting sodas or water, spoons/forks/extra napkins, etc. This is an asian place in a mainly asian neighborhood (as can be seen by the MANY asian restaurants and asian bank on balboa street) so service will naturally not be the best out there. If you want 5 star service, this would NOT be a place I would recommend.

However, the food was pretty good.  I had never tried xlb, or Shanghai Soup Dumplings, but they were to die for!  They gave me about 10 dumplings in a bamboo steam pot tray.  I just totally ignored their hard-to-eat with chopsticks and used their soup spoon to bring the dumplings from the bamboo pot tray  to my mouth and I was pleasantly surprised to see the soup INSIDE the pork dumplings (even though mentally I had already read about this in the reviews).  They ARE hot so you have to be careful (I'm glad I had my ice-cold coke sodas handy nearby which I quickly gulped right after swallowing the dumplings), but they are SOOOOOO good and filling with their light medium dumpling skins.  I think I could have gotten another order or two of dumplings, been full  and called it a day!    

But I ordered the other dishes earlier and decided to finish those off too.  After all, I'm always in the area and could go back to dine here at one of those other times.  And I'll DEFINITELY remember to bring a lot of napkins/paper towels to handle those soup dumpling spills! :-)  I loved the large chicken wings which were sweet and VERY hot - there were about 8-10 large pieces.  The combination fried rice was a surprise - it had LETTUCE in it which I've never seen before in the usual chinese fried rice but they give you a lot of big large shrimp as well as  a few large other items in it.  What I noticed about the fried rice was there were clumps of white rice because the rice had not been mixed thoroughly with the meat, but it was still a tasty accompaniment to the wings.  I WAS able to use my credit card and my order was only about $30.  I was able to bring home leftovers of 4 wings.  I definitely liked the food and would definitely come back for more.

excerpts: This place was highly recommended to me by my boss for 2 dishes: dry chicken wings and xiao long bao.
Let's be frank, service is a bit lacking.
We were here 15 minutes before anyone gave us the time of day.
The food on the other hand is actually pretty good.
I've had a lot of xiao long bao in my day and their XLB's are definitely above average.
The dry chicken wings are also pretty good; the chicken is very juicy and the skin is so crispy.
In terms of the sauce I think it's subjective to the person's palate.
After two pieces, the sauce started getting too sweet for me.
I still like San Tung's chicken better but this place is definitely a hit!

crispy and very spicy.

dry chicken wings.review:
well.. heres the deal... the pork belly... was fantastic!! OMGGGG... im drooling just thinking about it again. Unlike most places, the pork belly was cut pretty thinly.  and each slice practically melted in my mouth.  

The dry chicken wings... awesome.  crispy and very spicy.  well spicy enough.

However, the dumpling.. bleh.  I think i will stick with the dumpling king down the street for that.  I just dont think it was cooked long enough.  the skin was still a little hard and the meat i think was a little raw.  

But i will definitely come back for the pork belly and chicken wings... yummmm

(Haven't found any that is better) Other delicious dishes that are my favorite: pot stickers, soy beans (edamame) with bean curd noodles & pickled mustard greens, green onion pancakes, Shanghai noodles, braised noodles with green onion and dry shrimp, and malted dry chicken wings. excerpts: I wish i had room to order the honey walnut prawns and Shanghai noodles, because they looked amazing.
walnut prawns.author: Josh Giosue D.
walnut prawns.review:
Wow.... The wings game just got real.

We came here just because we were in the vicinity and it looked like it was poppin'.

We got the xiao long baos, wings and green onion pancake. My least favorite was definitely the green onion pancake, however, it wasn't bad. The XLBs were pretty good and i would get them again. The wings were out of this world, in my opinion better than San Tung.

I wish i had room to order the honey walnut prawns and Shanghai noodles, because they looked amazing. 


These place is great, one of the best chinese restaurants in the area.

excerpts: The walnut prawns?
walnut prawns.author: Janice C.
walnut prawns.review:
Brusque and slow service combined with ordinary food, I don't think I'll be back here anytime soon.   

You know I'm here for a reason and it's to check off an item on my Big Eat SF list:

#13 soup dumplings at Shanghai House. 

10 pieces of hot Xiao Long Bao brought out in a bamboo steamer.  The soft texture of the steamed wrapping paper, well-seasoned pork, and tasty soup in these one-bite dumplings make you thankful that these only cost $5.50.  (which would cost you $10 at Yank Sing)  

The other items we ordered were okay,  a little too heavy on the oyster sauce on our stir-fry Buddha's Delight which has broccoli, fried tofu, bok choy and carrots.   Our shrimp fried rice had a weird burnt taste although the shrimp itself was plump and tender.   The walnut prawns? a skip. 

This place is small but can probably accommodate around 30 people.  Be prepared to wait if they get busy.  

BTW, cash only.

excerpts: The other dishes were forgettable: flat stir-fried noodles with beef and vegetable, green onion pancakes, spicy braised tofu, and honey walnut prawns, while not the best in their respective classes, were actually good value relative to the prices.
walnut prawns.author: Ange L.
walnut prawns.review:
Shanghai House was a solid 2-star until the bill came... and after realizing that $8 per person (including tip) got our plump selves squared and good to go, I decided to add one additional star.  

This unassuming Chinese (or should I say, Shanghainese) establishment was tucked away in the far end of Richmond, away from the hustle and bustle of Clement Street (where, quite possibly, 90% of Inner Richmond Chinese restaurants are located).  As a result, parking situation is a tad better, and as we found out, prices are a lot lower.  

The wait... was still expected.  But then again, we had a large group and it was prime dinner time, so a 40-min wait was not horrendously out of line.  

As always, we had to try the pork Xiao Long Bao and compare it with the other legendary XLBs: Din Tai Fung and Joe's Shanghai.  While neither of these places could beat the price - 10 for $5.25 - I wasn't too impressed by the small, doughy variety with much-less-than-expected amount of soup in those little packets.  

The other dishes were forgettable: flat stir-fried noodles with beef and vegetable, green onion pancakes, spicy braised tofu, and honey walnut prawns, while not the best in their respective classes, were actually good value relative to the prices.
